dialogues.speaker: FRENCH SOLDIER
dialogues.text: (in French)

dialogues.speaker: THE FRENCH CAPTAIN LOOKS TO HIS WOUNDED MEN
dialogues.text: SHIP -- AND HE KNOWS IT’S OVER.

dialogues.speaker: FRENCH CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Strike the colors. EXT. —- H.M.S. MONARCH. — SUNSET

dialogues.speaker: THE CAPTAIN OF THE MONARCH, CAPTAIN TOMS, WATCHES AS THE
dialogues.text: FRENCH FLAG IS LOWERED -——

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN TOMS
dialogues.text: The surrender has been given. Prepare to board!

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: Prisoners, Sir! Civilians. INT. — HULL OF FRENCH SHIP. — CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take them aboard the Monarch and give them provisions.

dialogues.speaker: THE LAST CIVILIAN TO LEAVE THE CAGE IS A YOUNG, BEAUTIFUL
dialogues.text: WOMAN IN HER 20’S -- OLIVIA COLE. SHE STARTS TO GO ABOVE

dialogues.speaker: DECK WITH THE OTHERS.
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN TOMS (CONT’T - Tell us what happened, Miss?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: My brother and I were sailing aboard the Grafton to Hudson Bay when the French ran us aground. We had secured work in the Americas --

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: And your brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HENRY MADDOX (CONT’D) You’re safe now, Miss. On this I promise.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Will you free the others as well?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN TOMS
dialogues.text: Others?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Below.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: I could hear their screams at night, Sir. But then it stopped.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN TOMS
dialogues.text: Dead animals?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Sir. Witches. Four witches in cages. Their throats slashed. OLIVIA SCARED NOW ——

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Why were they here?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN TOMS
dialogues.text: The French are losing the war -- their people starved. These witches were tortured -- forced to search for treasure.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: Then why were they killed?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN TOMS
dialogues.text: Perhaps they found what they were looking for.

dialogues.speaker: DIAMOND IS STARING BACK AT HIM.
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN TOMS (CONT’D) The Eye of Poseidon. Legend says it once held its place in the center of the Trident.

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH SOLDIER
dialogues.text: The Trident of Poseidon?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN TOMS
dialogues.text: Imagine a Navy that could never be defeated. A nation that could never be conquered. To hold the Trident is to control more than the sea. It is to control the world.

dialogues.speaker: WITCH
dialogues.text: The Trident exists -- hidden where no Man can see. ONE OF THE WITCHES IS ALIVE INSIDE HER CAGE. SHE’S HALF D

dialogues.speaker: -- LOOKING UP AT CAPTAIN TOMS --
dialogues.text: WITCH (CONT’D) Only The Eye can show you the way.

dialogues.speaker: WITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A storm comes for you now. ‘Tis time, Captain. ‘Tis time to die.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH ROUGH SEAS. CAPTAIN TOMS IS ON DECK WATH H
dialogues.text: WAVES CRASHING OVER THE SIDES AS THEY FIGHT THE @m™-r* —

dialogues.speaker: FIRST MATE
dialogues.text: We've been blown off course, Sir! INT. — HULL OF MONARCH. — CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: Miss -- you should eat something.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Thank you, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: Sir? No, Miss, I’m no officer. My name is Henry Maddox -- Captain's servant for now.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Olivia Cole.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Henry, are you not afraid of the storm?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: I’m not scared of anything, Miss. They call me “Lucky” Maddox, because not a single man has died since I’ve come aboard.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Maybe they’re the lucky ones.

dialogues.speaker: SHE REACHES OUT AND TAKES HIS HAND
dialogues.text: OLIVIA (CONT’D) These scars are from a sickle. What kind of farm do you come from?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: We had clover and turnips.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Barley and wheat.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: Do you miss the harvest?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: I dream about it all the time.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: Then we dream together. SHE LOOKS DOWN -- REALIZES SHE’S STILL HOLDING HIS HAND - HENRY MADDOX (CONT’D) You’re not alone, Olivia. I’11 protect you. If you like. SHE LETS GO OF HIS HAND NOW -- HIDES A SMILE.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: You carry no weapon.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: It's my first season on the Monarch. Next month I get my irons.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Then how could you ever defend me?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: I told you. I’m Lucky.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN TOMS
dialogues.text: It’s not the wind. It’s the current. She’s pulling us in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into what, Sir?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN TOMS
dialogues.text: Into there.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST MATE
dialogues.text: THE DEVIL’S TRIANGLE!

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Ship off the bow!

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN TOMS
dialogues.text: That’s no ship. It’s a shipwreck.

dialogues.speaker: TORN APART
dialogues.text: SHIPWRECK IS ABOVE WATER -- AND SOMEHOW IT’S NOT SINKING.

dialogues.speaker: AT FIRST IT SEEMS TO BE DRIFTING
dialogues.text: SHIPWRECK IS SAILING WITHOUT SAILS --—

dialogues.speaker: FIRST MATE
dialogues.text: SHE’S COMING RIGHT AT US!!

dialogues.speaker: FIRST MATE
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN TOMS
dialogues.text: Prepare the cannons!

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN TOMS
dialogues.text: What are you waiting for! Ready the guns! THE MEN DON’T MOVE. NOISES ARE HEARD -— CREAKING SOUNDS.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: Olivia, wait here. Don’t move. DEAD SILENCE. ONE OF THE OLDER SOLDIERS STEPS BACK.

dialogues.speaker: OLD SOLDIER
dialogues.text: They say to enter these waters is to enter the gates of hell.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN TOMS
dialogues.text: I’LL HAVE NO TALK OF THAT!

dialogues.speaker: HORRIFIED --
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN TOMS (CONT’D) Take position.

dialogues.speaker: THE SOLDIERS PUSH THEMSELVES AGAINST THE WALLS
dialogues.text: DRIPPING FROM THEIR FACES AS THEY HOLD THEIR WEAPONS -—

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING INTO THE DARKNESS
dialogues.text: THE SOLDIERS READY TO FIRE -—

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER SOLDIER --
dialogues.text: MORE HANDS COMING THROUGH NOW -- WE DON’T SEE ANY HEADS O

dialogues.speaker: HENRY RUNNING NOW
dialogues.text: FEAR. HE GRABS HER AND PULLS HER THROUGH THE SHIP -—

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: What’s happening!!

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: Come with me! EXT. — MONARCH. - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: ARE RUNNING TO THE STERN OF THE MONARCH. HENRY GLANCES BA
dialogues.text: - KNOWS THEY ARE RUNNING OUT OF TIME --—

dialogues.speaker: HENRY GRABS THE TOP OF A BARREL
dialogues.text: HENRY MADDOX (CONT’D) GO NOW. I’M GOING TO DISTRACT THEM.

dialogues.speaker: HE WATCHES AS SHE FLOATS OVER THE WAVES
dialogues.text: ON EACH OTHER FOR A BEAT -—

dialogues.speaker: GHOST
dialogues.text: The last one.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOWS. HE SLOWLY REACHES IN
dialogues.text: DIAMOND -- HOLDS “THE EYE” UP TO THE LIGHT --

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: The Eye has come home.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND SLOWLY WALKS TOWARD HIM --
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN BRAND (CONT’D) No need to be afraid, boy. HENRY GLANCES OUT A GUNNER’S WINDOW -- SEES OLIVIA FLOATI

dialogues.speaker: AND HORRIFYING
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN BRAND (CONT’D) Today is your lucky day. I always keep one man alive.

dialogues.speaker: DARKNESS.
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN BRAND (CONT’D) One man to tell the tale.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: Today we dedicate the Royal Bank of Saint Martin -- the most secure banking institution in the Caribbean.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Our new vault is made from crucible steel. She is five inches thick -- stands as tall as any man and weighs an imperial ton. She will never be stolen or robbed --

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Governor has placed his personal gold reserves inside this new branch -- a bank protected by the Royal Guard!

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: With the opening of this bank -- we enter the modern world!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUT THE VAULT DOESN’T MOVE --

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: SHE WON’T BUDGE!!

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Excuse me. If I could have your attention for just one moment.

dialogues.speaker: THE CROWD REACTING AS JACK STEPS TO THE EDGE OF THE ROOF
dialogues.text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) I was wondering if you wouldn’t mind helping me to rob this bank.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: You are a mile from the sea, Pirate! Lower your weapon or you will be shot.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Being shot will do just fine.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: WHAT’S HAPPENING! !

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: We're taking the vault.

dialogues.speaker: DOORS
dialogues.text: HORSES STRAINING -- PULLING WITH ALL THEY’VE GOT --

dialogues.speaker: JACK ON THE ROOF
dialogues.text: MORE SHOTS FIRED -- AND JACK SUDDENLY REALIZES WHAT’S ABO

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: THEY’RE STEALING THE BANK!!

dialogues.speaker: TOWN
dialogues.text: JACK SEEING THE BRIDGE UP AHEAD -- REALIZES THE BANK WON’

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Bridge. BRIDGE!!!

dialogues.speaker: THE HORSES SPEED UNDER THE BRIDGE WHILE THE BANK SLAMS IN
dialogues.text: It --

dialogues.speaker: ONLY ROAD OUT OF TOWN.
dialogues.text: EXT. - JACK’S SHIP (THE DYING GULL). - LATER THAT DAY

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I told you robbing a bank would be easy.

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: You promised each of us a bar of gold. It’s been months since we've seen any spoils, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Am I to be blamed for the monetary failures of the men I steal from? Now line up so I may collect your daily tribute.

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: Tribute? We're starved, Captain. Yesterday we ate a rat.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: It was a very big rat. Luckily the ship is overrun with them -- and I charge very little for each.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: They are quite tasty.

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: I‘ll pay no tribute! We’ll never find treasure on a ship such as this.

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: I hear the pirate William Kidd is looking for hands -- has a ship with a hundred cannons.

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: Not to mention his balls -- 18 pounds each they say!

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Well -- it’s not the size that matters.  14.

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: We’re down to three cannonballs. Face it, Captain, your luck has run aground.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Let me remind you all that without me you'd all be poor, destitute, unwanted miscreants.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Jack, even with you we appear to be poor, destitute, unwanted miscreants.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Then I guess my secret must be shared.

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: Secret?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: There’s a treasure in Port Royal that will change our fortunes forever. I can’t speak its name -- as it has yet to come to me -- but there will soon be jewels stuffed in every man’s pockets. And those of you without pockets can shove them somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: Jewels?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Diamonds! Or my name isn’t Captain Jack Sparrow. THE MEN CHEER NOW -- JUST AS A RAT SCURRIES BY ON DECK. JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) That one’s on me.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Sir, I fear you’re about to lose command of this rotting ship. Perhaps it’s time to go ashore.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Ashore?  15.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Just for a year or two. It was a good run, Jack -- but it would seem your luck has turned. THIS IS HARD FOR GIBBS TO SAY.

dialogues.speaker: GIBS
dialogues.text: It’s over, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Nothing is over, Mr. Gibbs. All I need is my ship to put things right.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: You've spent years trying to free the Pearl from her bottle -- rubbed magic oils from Cape Raye and sorcerer's salt from Pimlico! You even danced naked in Dove’s Cove.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Dove's Cove had nothing to do with the Pearl. I just felt like dancing. JACK TURNS TO GIBBS NOW -—— JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) You say it’s over. I say it’s time to knock on a Red Door in Port Royal.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: A Red Door? No, Jack -- that witch talks to the devil himself.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I have no choice, Gibbs. I can’t be Captain Jack Sparrow without my ship. And I can’t have my ship without a witch.

dialogues.speaker: A BRITISH ARMY WAGON ROLLS BY FULL OF WOMEN
dialogues.text: “WITCHES” ROUNDED UP AND HEADING FOR THE JAILS. SOLDIERS FOOT TRAILING THE WAGON -——

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Witches of Port Royal, by order of Admiral Scarfield turn yourselves in. No good will come from hiding -- you will be found by the British Navy.  16.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOWS
dialogues.text: CARINA WEARS A PLAIN WHITE DRESS -- NO GLOVES OR HAT -—-

dialogues.speaker: QUICKLY MOVES THROUGH TOWN UNTIL SHE STOPS IN FRONT OF A
dialogues.text: SHOP. THE SIGN READS: SWIFT’S CHART HOUSE.

dialogues.speaker: MAPS. CHARTS. SHIPS LOGS, ALL PILED FLOOR TO CEILING.
dialogues.text: INT. — SWIFT’S CHART HOUSE. - DAY

dialogues.speaker: MR. SWIFT
dialogues.text: Did you not see the sign, Miss?

dialogues.speaker: MR. SWIFT, (FAT AND REPELLENT)
dialogues.text: HE’S WORKING ON AND SLOWLY WALKS TOWARD HER.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Sir, I require a lens. One strong enough to capture Venus.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SWIFT
dialogues.text: You. They're looking for you. You’re one of them!

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: No. Please -- I can pay you --

dialogues.speaker: MR. SWIFT
dialogues.text: WITCH! THERE’S A WITCH IN MY STORE!!!

dialogues.speaker: MR. SWIFT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you think you’re doing? That telescope was made by --

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Sir Frederick Herschel. I know. THE GUN IS SHAKING IN SWIFT’S HAND -- HIS FACE FULL OF RA

dialogues.speaker: MR. SWIFT
dialogues.text: No woman has ever touched my Herschel.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: With apologies, Sir. Your celestial fix is slightly off. I moved it two degrees North.

dialogues.speaker: MR. SWIFT
dialogues.text: You -- you -- what!?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Which means that map you've almost completed -- I’m afraid you'll have to start over.

dialogues.speaker: SWIFT GLANCES BACK AT HIS MAP
dialogues.text: WHILE HE’S DISTRACTED CARINA QUICKLY RUSHES PAST HIM INTO

dialogues.speaker: MR. SWIFT
dialogues.text: Start over... EXT. - SWIFT’S. - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL SCARFIELD
dialogues.text: Carina Smyth -- you will never again cast black magic toward the sky.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Black magic? You must be mistaken, Sir. I sew uniforms for the haberdasher each day --

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL SCARFIELD
dialogues.text: I will see you die, witch. Put her in the wagon!

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Sir, please, let me explain! THE MEN GRAB CARINA -- DRAG HER OFF TO THE WAGON.  18. EXT. - BARBOSSA’S SHIP (QUEEN ANNE’S REVENGE). - DAY

dialogues.speaker: PORCELAIN BOWLS
dialogues.text: BARBOSSA’S MEN HAVE DOCKED IN ST. JAMES -- THE PIRATES

dialogues.speaker: THE MEN ARE EATING LIKE KINGS AND DRINKING FROM BARRELS -
dialogues.text: THE EXACT OPPOSITE OF JACK’S SHIP -- INT. — CAPTAIN’S QUARTERS. - QUEEN ANNE’S. -— CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Sir, we know you said never to disturb you --

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: Or to come in without good cause --

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Or to speak without first asking ourselves if our thoughts were absolutely necessary --

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: Like the ship being on fire -- you'd want to know that.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: But it’s not on fire -- that being an example of a necessary thought. THE TWO MEN ARE SUDDENLY THROWN AGAINST THE WALL -—- PINN BACK FROM THE FORCE OF BLACKBEARD’S SWORD -- WHICH IS OUT POINTED AT THEM -—  19.

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: We just come from town, Sir. The British are enraged -- rounding up pirates and witches as they wish. In no time they'll find their way to the Queen Anne.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: It seems one of their ships went missing. The Monarch lost to the Triangle -- a full crew murdered at sea.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: And how do they know this?

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: A survivor, Sir. One man lived to tell the tale. AND NOW BARBOSSA LOOKS AT THEM -- HIS WHEELS SPINNING.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Where is he? EXT. —- PORT ROYAL. - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: The red door. Doesn’t look so bad, Scrum. You go first.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: Jack, I don’t keep company with witches. All of them covered in warts and boils. Makes me miss my Mum.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Your mother was a witch?

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: Just incredibly ugly.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Nothing to be afraid of, Scrum. Except that two-headed dog.  20.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: I’m not going in there. Even the Redcoats are afraid to touch her. Let’s escape before it’s too late.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I believe it’s too late to be too late.

dialogues.speaker: MELIA
dialogues.text: I've been expecting you, Jack Sparrow. Would you like some tea?

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: I could go for a spot of tea. AND SCRUM LEADS THE WAY INSIDE. INT. - MELIA’S SHACK. - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I’ve brought you some gold.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: On second thought -- I’1l pass on the tea.

dialogues.speaker: MELIA
dialogues.text: Each time I cast a spell it cost me a piece of myself. This is the price I pay for stepping to the other side. The question is -- what price will you pay to be Captain of the Pearl again?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Name it and I shall pay it.  21. MELIA STEPS CLOSER -- TAKES THE KNIFE AND CUTS JACK’S FIN

dialogues.speaker: MELIA
dialogues.text: Your blood. This is the price you agreed to pay when you came through my red door.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Might explain why you’re not very busy.

dialogues.speaker: MELIA
dialogues.text: My powers are not strong enough. You’re the one who will free the Pearl.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: MELIA
dialogues.text: It will be free when you find the Trident of Poseidon.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Hard to find something when you’re not looking for it.

dialogues.speaker: MELIA
dialogues.text: But you are -- you just don’t know it yet. You will find The Map No Man Can Read -- which will lead you inside the Devil’s Triangle. This is where the Trident lies.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: Jack -- did she say Devil’s --

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Time to go!

dialogues.speaker: MELIA
dialogues.text: You are wise to fear the Triangle. Captain Brand remains where you left him. Waiting 16 years to take the life that took his own. JACK TURNS TO HER NOW -- MORE THAN A BIT CONCERNED.  22.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Has it been 16 years? I’11 bet he’s forgotten all about me -- MELIA’S POT BOILING OVER NOW -- AND IN THE SEETHING WATER

dialogues.speaker: MELIA
dialogues.text: This is a battle from your past. You sank his ship -- left him to sink beneath the gates of hell -- imprisoned in the triangle. And like all who die there, his spirit will not rest until he has his revenge.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: He'll have to wait a bit longer -- as I have no plans to visit.

dialogues.speaker: MELIA
dialogues.text: You have no choice. If you want to live.

dialogues.speaker: MELIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The dead Captain holds The Eye of Poseidon -- the key to finding the Trident. And with the Trident -- he will finally be free.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Free? Metaphorically?

dialogues.speaker: MELIA
dialogues.text: Free to take his revenge on you. Your only hope is to find the Trident before he does.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: So let me get this straight. You're saying the only way for me to live, is to sail into the one place on earth I am sure to die?

dialogues.speaker: MELIA
dialogues.text: The Devil’s Triangle is your destiny.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Sorry -- don’t believe in destiny. Gets in the way of opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: MELIA
dialogues.text: There is no escaping it. Tonight you will be married, have two children, and kill 46 men in cold blood.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: Going to be a busy night.

dialogues.speaker: MELIA
dialogues.text: You came here to save a ship, to save your name. But your only hope is to save your life.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: And if I refuse to chase the ghosts of my past? OVER -- DRAWS JACK’S SWORD FROM HIS BELT.

dialogues.speaker: MELIA
dialogues.text: Then Brand will use this sword to cut your throat. THE DOOR OPENS BEHIND THEM NOW.

dialogues.speaker: MELIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your destiny is sealed, Jack Sparrow. Find the Trident or die. EXT. —- PORT ROYAL. - NIGHT JACK AND SCRUM RUSH OUT OF MELIA’S SHACK -- BOTH A BIT RATTLED AS THEY LOOK UP AT THE MOON.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: We never should have gone there, Jack. We have to find The Map No Man Can Read, which you're already looking for -- but just don’t know it.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: If I can’t read it, then why would I look for it?

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: But that naked witch says your throat will be cut by your own sword. Did I mention she was naked?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Problem solved.  24.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: You see, Scrum. My only destiny is a bottle of rum and a warm bed upstairs. That witch was a charlatan, a two bit four-flusher...

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: Jack -- is that your sword?

dialogues.speaker: BAR
dialogues.text: THAT JACK’S SWORD HAS DROPPED ONTO THE BAR.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: No. Must be a fish. A swordfish.

dialogues.speaker: THE LARGEST OF THE FISH FLIPS ITS TAIL AND KNOCKS THE SWO
dialogues.text: ONTO THE FLOOR -- WHERE IT’S QUICKLY KICKED ACROSS THE DI

dialogues.speaker: BY A DRUNK
dialogues.text: EVENTUALLY LANDING RIGHT AT JACK’'S FEET.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: That appears to be a double-edged bone and steel cutlass with a slight nick at the tip.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: No. There is no destiny!

dialogues.speaker: AND THEN HEADS FOR THE DOOR --
dialogues.text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) We'll try a different pub!

dialogues.speaker: PIG KELLY
dialogues.text: Well, if it isn’t the pirate who stole my ship! Jack looks at PIERRE “PIG” KELLY AND HIS FOUR LARGE MEN - ALL HOLDING WEAPONS.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Pig -- I’ve been looking for you. Wanted to give you this gold coin as compensation for borrowing the Gull.  25. JACK HOLDS UP THE GOLD COIN -- WHICH PIG TAKES.

dialogues.speaker: PIG KELLY
dialogues.text: You've been sailing on my ship.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: You have three. And this one’s not much of a ship. One gun, leaks in the hull, rats everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: Which are delicious by the way.

dialogues.speaker: PIG KELLY
dialogues.text: You’1ll settle your debt here and now.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Of course, Pig. Name your price.

dialogues.speaker: PIG KELLY
dialogues.text: Her name is Beatrice. And she’s my daughter. BEATRICE WALKS UP TO THEM NOW -- STARES AT JACK. PIG KELLY (CONT’D) She's a midwife -- no respectable man will have her. You'll do just fine. KELLY AND HIS MEN START TO LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I‘1l do what?

dialogues.speaker: PIG KELLY
dialogues.text: Marry her. Take her off my hands forever. To clear your debt.

dialogues.speaker: BEATRICE
dialogues.text: The honeymoon suite is waiting upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Remind me of the other option?

dialogues.speaker: PIG KELLY
dialogues.text: A bullet in your eye.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Scrum, go find me an eye patch.

dialogues.speaker: PIG KELLY
dialogues.text: Last chance.  26.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: As a Captain I will officiate the ceremony. How’s next Tuesday?

dialogues.speaker: PIG KELLY
dialogues.text: Say “I do” or die.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I’m trying. Having a bit of a midwife crisis.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: Jack, you remember the witch said you'd be married with kids?!

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: PIG KELLY
dialogues.text: Congratulations!

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Jack Sparrow, in the name of the King you are under arrest. You killed 46 men in cold blood aboard the H.M.S. Monarch. JACK STARES AT THE WIFE -- THE KIDS -- THE SOLDIERS. EVERYTHING THE WITCH SAID HAS COME TRUE.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: Jack -- can you find out if she has a sister?

dialogues.speaker: AN INJURED HENRY MADDOX LIES IN A HOSPITAL BED STARING OU
dialogues.text: THE WINDOW. HE’S LOOKING OUT TO SEA -- HIS EYES BLANK -- HORROR OF HIS ORDEAL STILL ETCHED ACROSS HIS FACE.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: It be said one lucky man survived the massacre of the Monarch. A Captain's servant now without his senses found alive at sea -- who tells of murderous ghosts filling the oceans with blood. BARBOSSA LEANS IN NOW -- KEEPS HIS SWORD AT HENRY’S THROA

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve come to hear the tale.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: Nobody believes in ghost stories.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Try me.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: There was a diamond on a French ship -- a yellow diamond found by witches --

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: A diamond in the shape of an eye? Some say it be the key to unlocking the Trident. As the legend goes.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: They took it aboard the Monarch -- and we were attacked by men -- dead men led by a Captain Brand. THE NAME CLEARLY REGISTERS WITH BARBOSSA. HENRY MADDOX (CONT’D) Will you take me back there, Sir?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: You wish to return?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: I left someone alive. Her name is Olivia -- and I made a promise to find her -- to save her. And that is what I will do.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Sorry, boy. I don’t sail with Redcoats. BARBOSSA TURNS TO LEAVE -—  28.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: The Eye will be his forever. There is no one to challenge a murderous ghost with a taste for blood.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Blood is common currency. Maybe he desires something far more valuable.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: What would that be?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: The one thing all dead men seek. Revenge.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL SCARFIELD
dialogues.text: We believe the massacre of the Monarch was the work of pirates. You don’t kill my men without paying a heavy debt.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: How about I marry your daughter?

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL SCARFIELD
dialogues.text: A pirate is responsible for butchering those men. Which means a pirate shall die for it.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Have you considered the work of William Kidd? I hear his ship has over 100 guns -- seems to be having a very good year.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL SCARFIELD
dialogues.text: William Kidd does not sail in these waters. But you do --

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: What about Red Beard? He’s very tough -- and that beard -- it’s very red. You'd get a nice crowd to see him die.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL SCARFIELD
dialogues.text: You pirates think you can challenge us? We’re the British Navy -- and we control the seas.  29.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: No one can control her. The ocean is as free as a pirate -- always will be.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL SCARFIELD
dialogues.text: But you’re not free. You’re guilty of murder and will face a public execution. How would you like to die? Hanging, firing squad, or a new invention -- the guillotine.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Guillotine. Sounds French. I love the French. How bad can it be?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: How are ya, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: TEAGUE
dialogues.text: Never better, Jackie. What are you in for?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Destiny. You?

dialogues.speaker: TEAGUE
dialogues.text: Lechery. By the way, if you're getting disemboweled ask for Victor.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Excellent tip. What do you know of the Eye of Poseidon?

dialogues.speaker: TEAGUE
dialogues.text: Witches found it. That’s why they’ve arrested them all -- they want the diamond back.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: If they’re searching for The Eye -- they're going after the Trident as well. THE BRITISH GRAB JACK -- TRY TO PULL HIM AWAY.  30.

dialogues.speaker: TEAGUE
dialogues.text: Every nation at war is searching for the Trident, Jackie. But it can never be found -- as it rests in Poseidon’s watery grave.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: The Tomb of Posedion?

dialogues.speaker: TEAGUE
dialogues.text: A tomb never to be disturbed, Jackie. For no man should hold the sea in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Dad -- how did you choose to die?

dialogues.speaker: TEAGUE
dialogues.text: Guillotine. Sounds French. And I love the French.

dialogues.speaker: BUNCH OF CUTTHROATS STARING AT HIM.
dialogues.text: INT. — JACK'S SHIP (THE DYING GULL). - DAY SCRUM IS FACING GIBBS AND THE REST OF JACK’S CREW -- WHO SEEM CONFUSED AS THEY STAND ON THE MAIN DECK.

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: Doesn’t make no sense, Scrum. Why would Jack get married and not invite any of us?

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: Maybe he’s ashamed of us.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: You're not following --

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: And why would he kill 46 men in cold blood?

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: On his wedding day no less.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: The point is -- Jack’s been arrested.

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: Since we did not attend the wedding -- are we obliged to make an offering of gifts?  31.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: He’s about to be killed straight away! We have to do something.

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: And why would we do that? Seems to me he’s lied to us, fleeced and swindled us at every turn.

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: And when we was going straight.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Are you forgetting the diamonds! Knowing Jack he’s probably got his hands on that treasure right now!

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: There is no treasure. Just another lie from Captain Sparrow.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Aye. But a lie from Jack Sparrow always leads to another lie -- a bigger lie -- a lie that on occasion leads to a grain of truth.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So if you be wanting your share of this lie -- you’ll have to save him!

dialogues.speaker: WITCH
dialogues.text: So what's these markings on the wall then?

dialogues.speaker: WITCH
dialogues.text: Casting spells no doubt. She’s going to free us all from the hangman's noose!

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: I’m no witch.  32. THEY ALL LAUGH AT HER -——

dialogues.speaker: WITCH
dialogues.text: Tell us then -- what is it you’re scribbling there? What are all those numbers?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: It’s an equation from Galileo’s diary. I believe it’s part of a map.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: What kind of map?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: You wouldn’t understand. It’s a Map --

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: -- No Man Can Read. AND NOW CARINA WALKS TO THE BARS --— AND JACK GETS TO HIS

dialogues.speaker: -- KNOWS HIS DESTINY IS STANDING DIRECTLY ACROSS FROM HIM
dialogues.text: THAT SHE ALONE CAN LEAD HIM WHERE HE NEEDS TO GO. MTHERE’ JUST ONE SMALL PROBLEM.

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Open the cells. It’s time to die.

dialogues.speaker: PRAYING TO HIMSELF. THE EXECUTIONER PULLS THE SWITCH, AND
dialogues.text: THE BLADE COMES DOWN HARD -- THE MAN’S HEAD ROLLING INTO

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: So that’s a guillotine? THEY DRAG JACK UP TO THE GUILLOTINE -- OPEN THE LOCKS --—

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've changed my mind. Like to go with firing squad. Is there someone I could talk to...

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Silence!  33.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: The French are obviously sick people. How about a good old-fashioned stoning -- gets the crowd involved.

dialogues.speaker: THEY SHOVE JACK INTO THE GUILLOTINE AND TRY TO LOCK HIM I
dialogues.text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) There’s quite a bit of blood on there. And a good portion of neck.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: These will be the last words of Carina Smyth. OUT A PIECE OF PAPER AND BEGINS TO READ. CARINA SMYTH (CONT’D) Good Sirs -- I am not a witch and have never practiced witchcraft. But I forgive your common dim-wittedness and feeble brains incapable of educated thought. In short, most of you have the mind of a goat -- Jack yells out from the guillotine.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: If I could request a word. Is it not common practice for those being executed to be offered a last meal?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Sir, I believe I was making a point. If you could just be patient.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: My head is about to be lopped off -- hence the urgency.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: And my neck is to be broken.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: On occasion the neck doesn’t break.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I’ve seen men swing for hours -- the life slowly choking out of them. Eyes bulging, tongue swelling -- not pretty.  34.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: May I finish!

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: The point is -- it’s entirely possible you still have hours left to whisper your last words, whereas my head will soon be in this basket staring up at my lifeless body -- which happens to be famished!

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Go ahead and kill him. I’11 wait.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t hear of it. Witches first.

dialogues.speaker: ENOUGH
dialogues.text: CARINA’S HANDS ARE TIED BEHIND HER BACK -- AND JACK WATCH AS THE EXECUTIONER STEPS FORWARD.

dialogues.speaker: WE NOW PUT TO DEATH THE PIRATE JACK
dialogues.text: SPARROW -—

dialogues.speaker: CLOSING HIS EYES --
dialogues.text: BUT AS THE BLADE DROPS AN EXPLOSION ROCKS THE TOWN -—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CANNON HAS BEEN DRAGGED TO THE MIDDLE OF TOWN BY JACK’S

dialogues.speaker: EXHAUSTED PIRATES STANDING BEHIND IT --
dialogues.text: SCRUM AND GIBBS QUICKLY RELOADING AS THE REST OF JACK’S C

dialogues.speaker: -- AS A THIRD CANNON BALL HITS THE WALL OF A BUILDING --
dialogues.text: SOLDIERS CRUSHED BY FALLING STONES --—

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK
dialogues.text: THE HANDFUL OF BRITISH START TO RETREAT -- TAKE COVER --—

dialogues.speaker: CARINA
dialogues.text: INCHES --—

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: THERE’S NO MORE CANNONBALLS!  36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROPE SNAPPING AND CARINA DROPPING HARD TO THE GROUND -— SLAMMING HER HEAD AS SHE’S KNOCKED COLD.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH ON A HILL ABOVE THE TO
dialogues.text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) Collect the girl, Mr. Gibbs. It’s time to leave Port Royal.

dialogues.speaker: THE DYING GULL
dialogues.text: SHIP -—-

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Shove off, boys!

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Un-lash the boot and bring the draw --

dialogues.speaker: PIG KELLY
dialogues.text: You think I’m letting you take my ship? Again?

dialogues.speaker: JACK TURNS TO SEE PIG KELLY STANDING BEHIND HIM ON DECK -
dialogues.text: GUN DRAWN AND AIMED AT JACK’'S FOREHEAD.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Well, Pig, it would appear you have no choice.

dialogues.speaker: PIG KELLY
dialogues.text: How do you figure? A GUN IS NOW PLACED AT KELLY’S HEAD. THE WEAPON COCKED --

dialogues.speaker: BEATRICE
dialogues.text: Step away from me husband.

dialogues.speaker: BEATRICE HAS HER OWN GUN OUT
dialogues.text: SPITS -- AND HER FATHER CAN HARDLY BELIEVE WHAT’S HAPPENI  37.

dialogues.speaker: PIG KELLY
dialogues.text: This loathsome pirate is trying to steal my ship.

dialogues.speaker: BEATRICE
dialogues.text: He’s already stolen me heart. JACK TAKES THE GUN FROM KELLY’S HAND AS SEVERAL PIRATES G HIM FROM BEHIND.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Thank you, darling. But I really must go now. My best to the children. JACK AT THE WHEEL -— JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) Draw the main! We’re shoving off to race the gallows!

dialogues.speaker: AS THE DYING GULL HEADS OUT TO SEA
dialogues.text: STAND ON THE DOCK WATCHING THEM GO --—

dialogues.speaker: I'LL BE WAITING
dialogues.text: PIG KELLY’S OWN MEN APPROACH WITH GUNS DRAWN -- OPEN FIRE

dialogues.speaker: THE GULL --
dialogues.text: AS PIG MOTIONS TO ANOTHER SHIP IN THE HARBOR --—

dialogues.speaker: PIG KELLY
dialogues.text: Ready the Essex! We’ll chase her down before the sun sets. EXT. - JACK’S SHIP. - DAY

dialogues.speaker: JACK SMILES AS HE LOOKS OUT AT THE HORIZON
dialogues.text: SEA AGAIN. SCRUM NEXT TO HIM -—

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: The crew won’t stand for a woman, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: She will lead me to the Trident.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: But a woman on board brings nothing but bad luck. And rabies.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Frivolous superstition, Mr. Scrum. As you can see, luck is steadfast on my side.  38. ONE OF THE CREW MEMBERS APPROACHES JACK WITH A SWORD.

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: Good news, Captain. I found this in town this morning. It was inside an empty barrel of rum -- THE CREW MEMBER HOLDS UP THE SWORD -- HANDS IT TO JACK. PIRATE #1 (CONT’D) I believe it’s yours. A double-edged bone and steel cutlass --

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: YES! I can see it’s mine!

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: It’s been a pleasure knowing you.

dialogues.speaker: AND JACK TOSSES THE SWORD INTO THE SEA --
dialogues.text: INT. - BARBOSSA’S SHIP. - DAY Barbossa is at the wheel of THE QUEEN ANNE’S REVENGE -- eyeing the sea as he holds BLACKBEARD’S SWORD. PINTEL AND RAGETTI APPROACH HIM -- BOTH A BIT HESITANT.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Sir, not that it’s our place to ask questions --

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: Or to question the answer that you may give to such a question --

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Which by right -- you need not answer -—

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: But the men be asking to which port we sail? Seeing as that British soldier mentioned the name of a Captain Brand.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: A Captain as dead as any man who dwells at the bottom of the sea.

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: And his crew -- very dead men one and all. As the tale is told.  39.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Tell the men we're searching for the Trident of Poseidon. A treasure so powerful it puts all others to shame.

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: But our ship is full of treasure, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Imagine all the warring nations having to bid for their own survival. A King’s ransom the likes of which no pirate has ever seen! This be the power of the Trident -- the last treasure any man need hold. Pintel and Ragetti look confused now.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Last treasure?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Now be the time to find a tranquil island -- a place to put my leg up. The Trident will be the last treasure these hands possess.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: And this Captain Brand? What should we tell the crew?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Tell them we’re about to tap on his door -- see if he’s home.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gentlemen -- welcome to The Devil's Triangle!

dialogues.speaker: AND NOW BARBOSSA CALMLY SAILS HIS SHIP STRAIGHT TOWARD TH
dialogues.text: DEVIL’S TRIANGLE -- USES HIS SWORD TO CONTROL THE WIND IN

dialogues.speaker: OF THEM IMMEDIATELY AWARE OF THEIR FATE.
dialogues.text: EXT. -— JACK’S SHIP. - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carina coughing up water -- soaking wet and furious as sh gets to her feet -- looks around at Jack -- the ship -- t crew. ALL THE MEN STARING AT HER NOW. SHE BACKS AWAY FROM

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: How did I get here? Where are you taking me?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Is that the thanks I get for saving your neck?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: You're that pirate -- Jack Sparrow.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Captain Jack Sparrow.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: What do you want with me? Where is my diary? JACK HOLDS UP HER DIARY.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: It’s just a bunch of numbers. I'’11 be needing that map. The Map No Man Can Read.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: If you could read it -- then it wouldn’t be called The Map No Man Can Read.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: She's got a point there, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Most of the men on this ship can’t read -- so that makes all maps The Map No Man Can Read.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: If no one can read it -- then you have no use for it or me.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Hard to argue there, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I need to free a ship from a bottle. And you have a map --

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Nobody has this map -- as it does not exist --  41.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Then why does it have a name?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: The name clearly defines it as an imperceptible object.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: I was about to say that.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Then we all agree there is no map?

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Settled!

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: You're confusing these poor men! Which is what witches do best!

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: Did he say “witches”?

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: Jack, tell us you didn’t bring a witch on a ship?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Of course not. Look at her luminous yellow hair. Those round and bountiful -- eyes. Does she resemble any witch you've seen?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: I am not a witch.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: You see. Not a witch.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: I’m an astronomer.

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: Oh, so you make hats?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: An astronomer contemplates the stars. The planets. This is what I was doing when they arrested me. I had mapped the solar system. A LONG BEAT AS THEY ALL STARE AT HER --—  42.

dialogues.speaker: SHE'S A WITCH
dialogues.text: Jack steps in front of her now -- draws his sword and put at her throat.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Allow me to simplify this equation. Give me that map or I'll let them kill you.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: If they kill me you’1ll never get the map.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Excellent bit of reasoning there, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: You can kidnap me, imprison me, kill me if you wish. But I’1ll never give you what you want! And now Jack puts the sword away.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: What I want is a cup of tea. Care to join me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carina is staring at her own hand -- can barely keep her open. SHE IS CLEARLY DRUNK -- trying desperately to focus

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: What kind of tea did you say it was?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Pirate’s tea. Family recipe. JACK STANDS BEHIND HER SPIKING HER TEA WITH RUM.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: It has a funny taste. I can’t quite figure it out --

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Unlike The Map No Man Can Read? Which you have solved. SHE SMILES NOW -- DRINKS SOME MORE --—  43.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Can you keep a secret, Captain Jack?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Why steal secrets if you’re not going to keep them?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: There’s a reason the Map has never been read by any man. Or woman. She leans in close now -- whispers to him. CARINA SMYTH (CONT’D) The Map is written in the stars.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Someone must have an enormous quill.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Galileo's diary dates back to the first astronomer -- Plato himself. The diary is full of celestial binomials -- equations passed down through the centuries from scholar to scholar -- the last being my father. None of them could figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: But you have?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Once every 243 years the planet Venus crosses directly in front of Orion’s Belt -- known as the Three Fingers of God. This event is known as The Transit of Venus.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I'll drink to that.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: This is the answer to the equation. With a clear sky the stars themselves will map the Devil’s Triangle.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: A map that will lead you to the Tomb of Poseidon. And the Trident inside.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: How could you know about the Trident?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: You're not the only witch in town.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: After tonight -- I’1l never be called a witch again!

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Tonight?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: As the sun sets -- my destiny begins! AND NOW CARINA PASSES OUT -- SHE’S FACE DOWN ON THE TABLE

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I hate destiny. EXT. -— DEVIL’S TRIANGLE. - DAY BARBOSSA HAS BLACKBEARD’S SWORD IN HAND -- HAS DELIBERATE

dialogues.speaker: BEGINS
dialogues.text: THE FOG AND CLOUDS CAST A DARK SHADOW ACROSS THE SHIP --— A FEW CREW MEMBERS SNEAK DOWN BELOW TO HIDE --—

dialogues.speaker: WIND
dialogues.text: AS BARBOSSA STANDS BACK NEAR THE WHEEL -——

dialogues.speaker: THE SHIP HAS BECOME A HAUNTED HOUSE
dialogues.text: EVERY CREAK UNDER THEIR FEET -- BUT THERE’S NO SIGN OF ANYTHING. UNTIL -—-

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Captain, is that a ship?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Shipwreck.

dialogues.speaker: THEM --
dialogues.text: BARBOSSA’S CREW AT THE FRONT OF THE SHIP ARE QUICKLY KILL

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND AND HIS VERY DEAD MEN HAVE COME ABOARD. SOM
dialogues.text: OF BARBOSSA’S MEN RUNNING FOR THEIR LIVES -- DIVING OFF T SHIP -—-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AND EVERYTHING -——

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: Pirates. Kill them all.  45.

dialogues.speaker: BORDER FOR THE TRIANGLE.
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN BRAND (CONT’D) You've kept half of your ship outside the triangle. Very clever.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTRAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: Although it doesn’t help the men on this side of the line.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: I always bring extra crew just in case. Welcome aboard The Revenge, Captain Brand.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTRAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: You know my name.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Aye. And I’ve come for a confluence. BRAND AND HIS MEN LAUGH AT THIS.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTRAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: Did you hear that, men? This pirate has come searching for us. All you have is your life to bargain with.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: I come with a tale.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTRAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: And what would this tale be about?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: There was a British Captain. A Captain who had in his command his own brother -- a brother by the name Eric. The two men never far apart.

dialogues.speaker: SIDE BY SIDE ON A BRITISH WAR SHIP
dialogues.text: A SPANISH GALLEON --—  46.

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY THEIR SHIP GETS ROCKED BY CANNON FIRE
dialogues.text: EXPLOSION BLOWING ERIC OVERBOARD --—

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: While engaged in battle with the Spanish, Eric was lost to the sea -- sinking beneath the waves.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And so this Captain’s heart was broken -- knowing he would never see his brother again. EXT. —- OPEN OCEAN. - DAY (FLASHBACK) A PIRATE SHIP sails into frame -- THE PIRATES FISHING A M

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But as fate would have it a pirate ship found the half-dead soldier -- dragged Eric from certain death and put him in chains. WE SEE ERIC ON THE PIRATE SHIP IN CHAINS -——

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: At first they thought to hold him for ransom, but then the Captain of this pirate ship saw something in him.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And this Captain decided to train him in the ways of the pirate. Taught him everything he knew -- how to steal and plunder -- how to enjoin a group of knaves who refuse all orders.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He was taught every vile trick this Captain knew, until Eric was ready to take on a ship of his own. Only now he would be a pirate Captain -- with a pirate name stealing his own fortune at sea.  47. WE SEE ERIC at the wheel of his own Pirate ship -- lookin the horizon --

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And so it was. Until one day when the pirate Eric was attacked in full force by the British Navy. EXPLOSIONS ROCKING ERIC’S SHIP -- MEN DEAD ALL AROUND --

dialogues.speaker: ERIC BRAND
dialogues.text: Strike the colors! Lower the flag!!

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He tried to surrender -- but the Captain of the British ship had a loathing for all pirates. He kept firing until he burned the pirate Eric right out of the water.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You see -- this Captain had no idea he was killing his own brother. Murdering the only thing he loved.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND WATCHING THE PIRATE SHIP SINK --
dialogues.text: SEEING THE FACE OF HIS BROTHER staring across at him --

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And upon the realization of what he had done, this Captain soon went into a rage. And he vowed revenge on one man. Captain Jack Sparrow. The man who turned your brother into a pirate.

dialogues.speaker: WE SEE CAPTAIN BRAND RAISE HIS SWORD
dialogues.text: THE BLACK PEARL --—

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And so he chased Jack into the waters of the Devil’s Triangle -- where Jack waited for him in a devilish fog -- springing a trap that would send him to the bottom of the sea. WE SEE THE BLACK PEARL BLOWING BRAND’S SHIP OUT OF THE WA

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: And as the Captain sank to the gates of hell -- a spirit with unfinished business rose in his place.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: You were on the Pearl?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Aye. I saw you die. And soon after I planned a mutiny against Jack Sparrow and took the ship as my own.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: So my enemy is your enemy?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: More than you could ever know.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: The Eye.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: Bring him to me -- and I will give you The Eye. From this moment on -- you have a deal with the dead.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: You'll pardon me for not shaking on it.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Mr. Scrum -- wake her up.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: What’s happening?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: The sun is down. I believe there’s a map to be found. CARINA TAKES THE TELESCOPE FROM JACK’S HAND -- BEGINS TO

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: It begins. The Transit of Venus has --

dialogues.speaker: MR. GIBBS
dialogues.text: It’s a surprise attack, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Pig Kelly has come to collect his debt. Which is my neck.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: If I could have a bit of quiet --

dialogues.speaker: MR. GIBBS
dialogues.text: He’1l be on us in no time.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Weapons, Mr. Gibbs?

dialogues.speaker: MR. GIBBS
dialogues.text: No cannon -- no balls. We have three muskets, one swivel and four barrels of powder.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: And we're being chased by a fully loaded shallop with twelve heavy guns.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: We can’t fight her -- and we can’t outrun those guns.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GIBBS
dialogues.text: Should we strike the colors? Jack thinking for a BEAT --  50.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: No need to surrender. You said it yourself, this is a surprise attack.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GIBBS
dialogues.text: Yes, but this is their surprise, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Depends which way you look at it. EXT. —- ESSEX. - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: CREW MEMBER
dialogues.text: SIR -- THERE’S SMOKE COMING FROM THE

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE EYEGLASS
dialogues.text: OF JACK’S SHIP --

dialogues.speaker: PIG KELLY
dialogues.text: What’s he doing? EXT. -— JACK'S SHIP. —- CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: BILLOWING THICK BLACK SMOKE --
dialogues.text: EXT. -— KELLY’S SHIP. - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: PIG KELLY
dialogues.text: He’s lit the powder.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY AT THE WHEEL NOW
dialogues.text: SMOKE --— PIG KELLY (CONT’D) You can run but you can’t hide, Jack Sparrow! KELLY SAILS STRAIGHT INTO THE CURTAIN OF BLACK SMOKE -— EVERYONE BLINDED FOR A BEAT AS THEY WAIT TO EMERGE -—

dialogues.speaker: AS THEY COME OUT OF THE BLACKNESS --
dialogues.text: THEY ARE SHOCKED TO SEE JACK’S SHIP WAITING FOR THEM ON T

dialogues.speaker: OTHER SIDE --
dialogues.text: PIG KELLY (CONT’D) He lowered his sails and dropped anchor!!

dialogues.speaker: CREW MEMBER
dialogues.text: SURPRISE ATTACK!! WE’RE TAKING A

dialogues.speaker: KNOCKED
dialogues.text: JACK’S SHIP PIERCING THE HULL OF THE ESSEX -- A HUGE HOLE PIG’S SHIP AS WATER FLOWS IN -—-

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KELLY AND HIS CREW SWING ACROSS TO JACK’S SHIP -- GUNS OUT AS JACK’S CREW FIGHTS KELLY’S MEN --

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Not exactly sure which side this sword is on.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Venus is crossing through the straits of fire toward Orion! Right Ascension at 101.287 degrees, Declination -- 16.716 degrees.

dialogues.speaker: SKY NOW PART OF THE EQUATION AS A MAP BEGINS TO FORM --
dialogues.text: MEN FIGHTING -- PIRATES STABBING KELLY’S MEN -- GUNS FIRI  52.

dialogues.speaker: A MAN DROPS DEAD NEXT TO HER
dialogues.text: INCHES -- CONTINUES TO DRAW THE MAP —— CARINA SMYTH (CONT’D) This is incredible -- Venus is moving North.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA CRAWLING TOWARD IT
dialogues.text: FIGHT AND DIE ALL AROUND HER -——

dialogues.speaker: CARINA REACHING FOR THE SCOPE
dialogues.text: DECK. SHE PICKS IT UP -- SEES JACK CORNERED BY KELLY --—

dialogues.speaker: CARINA FIRES THE GUN
dialogues.text: STABS ONE OF KELLY’S MEN -- WHO FALLS ACROSS A ROPE AND C

dialogues.speaker: CARINA DROPS THE GUN AND GOES BACK TO THE SKY --
dialogues.text: KELLY’S MEN RETREATING NOW -- RUSHING BACK TO THEIR OWN S

dialogues.speaker: LOOKS TO THE SKY
dialogues.text: WE SEE KELLY’S MEN QUICKLY SAILING AWAY -- JACK AND HIS C

dialogues.speaker: CHEERING THEIR VICTORY --
dialogues.text: CARINA SMYTH (CONT’D) Venus has disappeared behind Orion and the Three Fingers of God.

dialogues.speaker: MAP IN THE SHAPE OF A TRIANGLE. EVERYONE TURNS TO HER NOW
dialogues.text: CARINA SMYTH (CONT’D) I was right -- the map exists! This is the Triangle -- and this is an island inside it --

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: An island in the Devil’s Triangle?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: An island no man has ever seen.  53.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: From a map no man can read?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: This is where we'll find the Tomb of Poseidon!

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Carina -- perhaps we should talk in private.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: As is my right -- I will name it the Coffin Island -- after the coffin star Delphinus. There is a clear passage from the West, Jack -- it is here that we will find the Trident! Gentleman -- set sail for the Devil’s Triangle --

dialogues.speaker: JACK IS ROWING A LONGBOAT
dialogues.text: ACROSS AT CARINA WHO IS CASUALLY STUDYING HER MAP -——

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: So that was a mutiny. I must admit it was rather exciting. All those swords and guns. The larger men holding you down and beating you when you refused to leave. The smaller men lining up to slap you --

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: You just cost me the command of two ships.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Two?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: One was in a bottle. Long story.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: And you blame me? The woman you kidnapped?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: You were the only witch on the ship.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: I am not a witch!

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: And I am not a Captain!

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: On that we both agree.  54.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: In case you have forgotten, the aforementioned kidnapping also included the saving of your neck --

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: You did not save me out of courtesy. You seek the Trident --

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I have no choice. There’s a ghost who dwells in the haunted waters of the Triangle, a spirit plotting his escape.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: A spirit?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I have to find the Trident before he does. CARINA STARING AT HIM -- CAN’T HELP BUT LAUGH --

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Ghosts! That is what all of you pirates are afraid of? GHOSTS!!

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Yes. Ghosts. And lizards. And Quakers.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: I assure you, there are no ghosts in the Devil’s Triangle or anywhere else. Science does not support it.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: And if you're wrong?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Did I not predict the crossing of Venus?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: You think you’re the only one who knows anything about Venus? Venus was the Roman goddess of love and beauty.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: And who taught you that?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: A girl named Venus --

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Was she academically inclined?  55.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: More like vertically reclined.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: My calculations are precise and true. I’m not just an astronomer -- I’m also a horologist.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: No shame in that, dear. We all have to earn a living.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: No. A Horologist!

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Yes. So was Venus. Although she didn’t shout it quite as loud as you. I must say you seem very proud!

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Horology is the study of time.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: She was constantly studying her watch.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Time is everything, Captain Sparrow.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I prefer timing. CARINA HOLDS UP THE WATCH AROUND HER NECK.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: This Chronometer keeps the exact time in London. If I make an altitude measurement to a known heavenly body such as the sun -- we will find land. LIGHT REFLECTS OFF THE CHRONOMETER -- BLINDING JACK.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: That thing will draw attention where it’s not wanted.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: East is that way. Row!

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: You are sailing with Captain Jack Sparrow. I will find land with this compass. A compass which takes me to the exact place I wish to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) Broken. Let’s try it your way. INT. —- MELIA’S SHACK. - DAY THE BRITISH break down the door to MELIA’S SHACK -- weapo at the ready. ADMIRAL SCARFIELD SLOWLY WALKS IN -- LOOKS

dialogues.speaker: MELIA
dialogues.text: Admiral Scarfield. Do you know the price you pay for coming in my door?

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL SCARFIELD
dialogues.text: Get her dressed.

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Sir, we’ve been warned never to touch this one.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL SCARFIELD
dialogues.text: She's coming with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCARFIELD and his men lead Melia down to the prison. They push her into the WITCH’S CELL -- WHICH IS FULL OF WOMEN WAITING TO BE EXECUTED.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL SCARFIELD
dialogues.text: The wall. Read it. THE “WITCHES” MOVE ASIDE FOR MELIA -- CLEARLY THEY FEAR H

dialogues.speaker: MELIA WALKS TOWARD THE BACK WALL, THE WALL WHERE CARINA H
dialogues.text: DRAWN THE EQUATIONS FOR THE “MAP NO MAN CAN READ.” ADMIRAL SCARFIELD (CONT’D) Read it or die.

dialogues.speaker: IMAGE ON THE WALL.
dialogues.text: ADMIRAL SCARFIELD (CONT’D) You will lead us to the Trident. Or I'll kill them all.

dialogues.speaker: HE MOTIONS TO THE OTHER WOMEN
dialogues.text: “WITCHES.” ADMIRAL SCARFIELD (CONT’D) Their destiny is in your hands.  57. She looks to Scarfield and slowly nods. ADMIRAL SCARFIELD (CONT’D) Prepare the ship. And the cage. EXT. - QUEEN ANNE’S REVENGE. - DAY BARBOSSA IS USING BLACKBEARD’S SWORD TO PUSH HIS SHIP TO

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Captain, perhaps you should decrease the demands we’re putting on the ship!

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: It feels as if we’re going to break the wind.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: The condemned of Port Royal told us Jack had escaped to these waters. I know the lines he favors to sail. We'll hunt him as the day is long.

dialogues.speaker: CREW MEMBER
dialogues.text: Captain -- off the bow!! AND NOW BARBOSSA SEES A SHIP IN THE DISTANCE -—-—

dialogues.speaker: RUN HER DOWN
dialogues.text: EXT. - JACK’S SHIP. - THE DYING GULL. - LATER Barbossa and his men have boarded Jack's ship. The crew standing down as Barbossa steps toward them.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Where is he, Gibbs?

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: It was a mutiny.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: It always is.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: We set Jack adrift. With a witch. This gets Barbossa’s attention.  58.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: A witch who pulled a map from the stars. AND NOW BARBOSSA SLOWLY TURNS -- LOOKS OUT TO SEA -—-

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Mr. Ragetti! Find me the nearest shore. RAGETTI BRINGS OVER A MAP -——

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There is but one island a longboat could reach from this vile ship! Jack Sparrow will be in Coronation Bay -- or he’ll be at the bottom of the sea.

dialogues.speaker: AND NOW BARBOSSA SEES SOMETHING ELSE
dialogues.text: AND PULLS OUT THE BLACK PEARL IN THE BOTTLE -——

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gentlemen -- I’1l be taking my ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carina is sweating, suffering from the heat as she reads chronometer -- taking notes as she tries to figure out wh they are and where to go. Jack is exhausted -- still rowi - but secretly happy that she is lost.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: It would appear your superlative brain has us led us astray. This could well be the end. JACK TAKES OUT A SMALL LEATHER FLASK -- DRINKS FROM IT.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: You have water!

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Of course not. I’m trying to survive. JACK FINISHES THE RUM -- LICKS THE LAST DROP. JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) Now I’m in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: You are an abject creature. A befouled pirate.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: High praise coming from a horologist.  59.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA IS READING THE MAP NOW
dialogues.text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) Something wrong with your map?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: I don’t require any help.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Perhaps I should take a look -- seeing as Maps are part of my chosen vocation.

dialogues.speaker: AWAY FROM HIM.
dialogues.text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) Where did you get that earring?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: A gift from my father -- a father I never knew.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: A clover is bad luck at sea. He wasn’t a sailor.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: He was a scientist. The earring was left to me after he died -- along with a love of the stars. The most beautiful thing there is.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Nothing compares with the beauty of the sea.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Don’t you ever look up?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Only when I’m flat on my back. You take your stars, and I'll take my horizon.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: They are forever connected. A map maker’s sextant calculates the angle between a star and the horizon. So even if they are worlds apart, they are forever entwined -- the stars and the horizon existing as lovers.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Lovers? As in we’re lost at sea and tired of rowing and I won’t say a word?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: No. Lovers in the tragic sense. As they are destined to never be together.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: May I say that for someone with such high intellect -- you have us unequivocally lost.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: You’re the only one who’s lost, Jack Sparrow.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I assure you I can smell land when close by -- and I smell nothing --

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Land! Right on time.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: That might be me.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: We need to find passage into the Triangle --

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Luckily this is a very friendly place. All you have to do is ask that group of men for assistance -- and we shall have ourselves a ship and a crew. CARINA LOOKS OVER AT FOUR MEN --—

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Bad luck for a man of the sea to ask assistance of another sailor without the intercession of a feminine gull.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Then I shall go right away. I’m glad I can finally trust you.

dialogues.speaker: JACK PULLS HER IN AND GIVES HER A KISS
dialogues.text: BEAT. When he pulls back she stares at him -- confused. CARINA SMYTH (CONT’D) Why did you do that?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: For luck.

dialogues.speaker: HE QUICKLY TURNS AND RUNS INTO THE FIRST PUB HE CAN FIND
dialogues.text: EXT. — CORONATION BAY. - DAY

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, my name is Carina Smyth -- and I am looking for a ship and a crew to take me into the Devil’s Triangle. Or more precisely, the Coffin Island -- which I have recently named -- and which has never been seen by any man.

dialogues.speaker: STANDS IN THE SHADOWS
dialogues.text: CARINA SMYTH (CONT’D) May I also say that I am not a witch. But I do have this map -- SHE REACHES FOR THE MAP -- SUDDENLY REALIZES IT’S GONE. CARINA SMYTH (CONT’D) The map? JACK!!!

dialogues.speaker: TRADER
dialogues.text: Before you go, Miss. Would you mind showing us your teeth?  62.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: To trust.

dialogues.speaker: OVER IN HIS HAND
dialogues.text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) She's the only one who can read it.

dialogues.speaker: GAMBLER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I‘1l bet ten pieces.

dialogues.speaker: GAMBLER
dialogues.text: And I'll raise this here sword -- washed ashore in Coronation Bay this morning... JACK HEARS THE WORD “SWORD” AND STARTS TO PANIC --

dialogues.speaker: GAMBLER
dialogues.text: This is a fine saber! A double-edged bone and steel cutlass with a slight nick at the tip --

dialogues.speaker: GAMBLER
dialogues.text: And what you be looking at?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Destiny...

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Gentlemen -- the auction is about to begin.  63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BY ROPE -- EACH OF THE WOMEN WEARING “FANCY” DRESSES. THE

dialogues.speaker: AUCTIONEER
dialogues.text: First up is this fresh young lass -- come up here darling and turn about -- show us your larboard side.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Let me just say that I forgive your common dim-wittedness and feeble brains incapable of educated -- THEY QUICKLY PUT A GAG IN CARINA’S MOUTH AS THE AUCTIONEE STEPS FORWARD --—

dialogues.speaker: AUCTIONEER
dialogues.text: I will start the bidding at one pieces of eight -- and with this one I’1l throw in a goat.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: This one looks of unremarkable stock -- hard to imagine any warmth coming off those skin and bones. But alas -- I’ll bid one and let’s be done with it!

dialogues.speaker: AUCTIONEER
dialogues.text: I have one pieces of eight!

dialogues.speaker: DISGUSTING TRADER
dialogues.text: I'll bid two.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Three!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MAN’S POCKETS -- FLIPPING COINS TO HIMSELF AS HE

dialogues.speaker: WITH EACH BID JACK IS STEALING MONEY FASTER AND FASTER --
dialogues.text: HAND IN THE MAN’S POCKET AND THE OTHER IN HIS JACKET -—

dialogues.speaker: NOW WAIT A SECOND
dialogues.text: JACK HOLDING UP THE MAN’S MONEY -- SHOWING THE ROOM HIS COINS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AUCTIONEER (CONT’D) Now the last of the bids was ten! Going once! Going twice! A VOICE FROM THE BACK OF THE ROOM STOPS THE CROWD.

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: You belong to me now.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA IS TERRIFIED OF THE PIRATE
dialogues.text: ROPES AS SHE’S TAKEN OFF THE PLATFORM -- YELLING THROUGH GAG AS JACK WATCHES HER MOVE THROUGH THE CROWD. EXT. - DOCKS OF CORONATION BAY. - QUEEN ANNE’S. - DAY

dialogues.speaker: DOCKS
dialogues.text: HE CAN SEE CARINA IN THE WINDOW OF THE CAPTAIN’S QUARTERS

dialogues.speaker: AND PULLS TWO PIRATES OVERBOARD AS HE USES THEM TO HELP
dialogues.text: HIMSELF CLIMB ONTO THE MAIN DECK --—

dialogues.speaker: HE SNEAKS ALONG THE DECK
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN’S QUARTERS AND CLIMBS INTO A WINDOW --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK CLIMBS INTO THE WINDOW OF THE CAPTAIN’S QUARTERS --

dialogues.speaker: A MATCH IS STRUCK
dialogues.text: AND THERE’S BARBOSSA AND HIS MEN SITTING AND WAITING FOR

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Evening, Jack. This be the witch you're looking for? BARBOSSA’S MEN DRAW WEAPONS -- SURROUND JACK FROM ALL SID CARINA LOOKS AT HIM -- TRIES TO TALK THROUGH HER GAG.  66.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you recall why there was mutiny aboard the Pearl all those years ago?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I'll take a swag -- did it have something to do with treasure?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: No, we planned to take the ship from you long before Cortez. Around the time you rescued a British soldier -- his life barely a whisper.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Eric the Pirate.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: This was no pirate. He wore the red coat of a soldier trained to kill our kind. But you taught him our ways -- passed over your own crew to commission him a ship.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: You still seem bitter, Hector.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Not me, Jack. Eric’s brother. Captain Brand’s got a yearning to meet you in the flesh. Although he won’t be wearing his. INT. - JACK’S SHIP (DYING GULL). - DAY

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: Mutiny seemed like a very good idea at the time.

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: I believe we were caught up in the moment.

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: You think Jack would consider coming back --

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: No harm in asking.  67.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GIBBS
dialogues.text: He’s probably dead from exposure. Or eaten by sharks.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: Very true. Hard not to feel a bit responsible.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Scrum, Jack always told me that if something were to happen, you should be Captain.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: Me? He said that?

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Them be Jack’s wishes. Now go and take the wheel, son -- and take this here hat. The hat of a Captain. SCRUM TAKES THE HAT, PUTS IT ON.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: This be my proudest moment indeed.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: You deserve it.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: SCARFIELD
dialogues.text: Which of you men is Captain of this vile ship! SCRUM STEPS FORWARD, EXCITED.  68.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: Me. That’s me.

dialogues.speaker: SCARFIELD
dialogues.text: Beat him first and longest. INT. - BRITISH SHIP. - BRIG. -—- CONTINUOUS The Pirates are brought down to the brig of the British s are herded toward the BRIG. A BRUISED AND BATTERED SCRUM

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: That be the witch from Port Royal.

dialogues.speaker: SCARFIELD
dialogues.text: The race for the Trident is one the British will not lose. Tell me where to sail.

dialogues.speaker: MELIA
dialogues.text: We must find Jack Sparrow. EXT. —- BARBOSSA’S SHIP. - QUEEN ANNE'S REVENGE. - NIGHT CARINA IS TIED TO THE MAST, LOOKING OUT AT THE STARS.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: You'll pardon my forward nature, Miss, but perhaps you can tell me how Jack Sparrow come to hold a map such as this?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: I drew it.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: There be no island in the Triangle.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: No island you’ve ever seen. It hides the Tomb of Poseidon.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: I know an unfinished treasure map when I see one. Now who holds the rest of it?  69.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: I’m not sure. I finished the equation -- did everything right. It should be here.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Equation?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Handed down to me in Galileo’s Diary. An equation no man had ever solved --

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: To find a Map No Man Could Read? BARBOSSA STANDS THERE NOW -—

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve heard of such a map. But this can’t be it.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: I copied that map from the stars, where it was hidden for thousands of years.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Impossible. No woman can read the stars.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: So you believe you know more of the constellations than I? CARINA SMYTH (CONT’D) On that I’d wager.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: I'll happily untie your hands -- if you can name one star.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Go on and choose. AND BARBOSSA POINTS TO A SPOT IN THE SKY.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: That one -- the brightest in the North. SHE STARES AT IT -- DOESN'T SAY A WORD FOR A LONG BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (CONT'D)
