dialogues.text: I didn’t think so. HE TURNS TO WALK AWAY.  70.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Carina. That is the star Carina. Barbossa turns back to her now. CARINA SMYTH (CONT’D) The star which gave me my name. Barbossa looks at the star -- then pulls his knife and wa back to her. She closes her eyes -- waiting to be killed

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: I’m a pirate. Not a killer.

dialogues.speaker: HIM.
dialogues.text: INT. - BARBOSSA’S QUARTERS. - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: HE THEN TAKES OUT AN EARRING
dialogues.text: TO CARINA’S. THE EXACT SAME CLOVER DESIGN. WE PUSH IN ON BARBOSSA -- AND SUDDENLY IT LOOKS LIKE HE’S SEEN A GHOST. INT. —- QUEEN ANNE'S REVENGE. - BRIG. - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Now that’s a big rat.

dialogues.speaker: HE SEES JACK IN CHAINS --
dialogues.text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) You there, boy! Could you lend me a hand?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: I seek no trouble.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: You're a stowaway on a pirate ship. Trouble is all that’s left. What is your name?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: Henry Maddox. I made my way to Coronation Bay to secure passage back to the Triangle.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Back?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: I was aboard the massacre of the Monarch.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: So you survived Captain Brand?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: As did a girl. I knew her less than a day. But I promised her I'd find her - - save her.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: A word of advice, Henry. Risking your life for women in distress is a laborious way to make a living. Much better to cause the distress, kidnap the women, then take a ransom.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: I will rescue her.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Being as your aspirations are to rescue -- why not start with me?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: I know not what you’ve done, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: It’s not what I’ve done -- it’s what I’m about to do. And that is to squeal like a parrot. STOWAWAY NAMED

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: SHHHHHH!! Quiet. Okay -- I’1l get you out.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: There must be a key to these chains. HENRY GRABS A CHIPPING HAMMER OFF THE WALL.  72.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: I won’t be needing any key. INT. - BARBOSSA’S SHIP. - SUNRISE

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Mr. Barbossa, what will you do with Jack when we get there?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: There's a price to pay for finding things not meant to be found.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: And Jack's life is that price?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: I'll be trading an eye for an eye. You may have the map -- but I’1l have the key. In the shape of a diamond.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: He’s a fellow pirate, is he not?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Do you desire to find the Trident?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: More than you could know.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: To what end, might I ask?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: I will present it to the King -- hand him his greatest treasure. And from that day forward my name will be pronounced with high regard. And I’1l never be called a witch again.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: So Jack's life is a reasonable expense. Wouldn’t you agree? And now he looks at her -- sees her concern.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: You have no loyalty.  73.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: A pirate’s life is spent loyal to the sea.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: The sea is not alive, Mr. Barbossa. It cannot return favor.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Nor can any pirate.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: So you feel nothing for any living soul?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: I'd be lying to pretend otherwise. INT. - QUEEN ANNE’S REVENGE. - BRIG. -— CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: THE CHIPPING HAMMER RAISED ABOVE HIS HEAD.
dialogues.text: THE LOCK HE’S AIMING FOR IS RIGHT BY JACK’S NECK.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Have you ever defeated a lock before?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: Never. BARBOSSA’S MEN ARE COMING DOWN THE STAIRS INTO THE BRIG -

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: This would be an excellent time.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY SWINGS THE HAMMER
dialogues.text: BARBOSSA’S MEN AT THE BOTTOM OF THE STAIRS -- AS HENRY TU

dialogues.speaker: BACK
dialogues.text: TOSSES ONE TO HENRY -— JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) Are you as good with a sword as you are with a hammer?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: I’ve never actually had a sword of my own. I was a Captain’s servant --

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Follow me. We’re taking the ship.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: The two of us?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I do it all the time. EXT. —- QUEEN ANNE’S REVENGE. - SUNRISE Barbossa looks determined as he sails toward the boundary the triangle. THE BLACK PEARL SITS IN THE BOTTLE NEXT TO HIM.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: There be plenty of room at the bow. THE MEN DON’T MOVE A MUSCLE.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Mr. Barbossa -- are you afraid of ghosts?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Only when they’re armed.

dialogues.speaker: WAVES LASHING THE REVENGE AS THE WIND STARTS TO BLOW IT
dialogues.text: TOWARD THE TRIANGLE -— AS A SWORD IS SUDDENLY PLACED AT BARBOSSA’S BACK -- JACK STANDING BEHIND HIM --—

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I'll be taking the Pearl, Hector.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: I'd be careful, Jack. This sword is the only thing that’s keeping us from crossing those rocks.  75.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Rejig the row. We won’t be sailing in today.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: I've waited a lifetime to hold the Trident.

dialogues.speaker: AND NOW BARBOSSA TAKES OUT HIS SWORD
dialogues.text: WITH JACK -—-

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I'm willing to risk the same.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Then let’s finish this once and for all.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE SMOKE --
dialogues.text: AND THERE’S THE BRITISH WAR SHIP COMING ALONG SIDE --

dialogues.speaker: JACK AND BARBOSSA SLOWLY GETTING TO THEIR FEET --
dialogues.text: BARBOSSA’S SWORD HAS BEEN KNOCKED ACROSS THE DECK --

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: A British gunner.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: She's got a hundred guns, Captain!

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Take the wheel, Jack. Killing each other will have to wait.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS AND THE OTHER PRISONERS KNOCKED BACK IN THEIR CELLS
dialogues.text: MELIA’S CAGE IS BLOWN OPEN -- THE DOOR BROKEN OFF.

dialogues.speaker: PLACE AT THE EDGE OF THE TRIANGLE --
dialogues.text: METAL HOOKS THROWN ACROSS AS THE SHIPS ARE JOINED -—-

dialogues.speaker: JACK FIGHTING SIDE BY SIDE WITH BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: BLUNDERBUSS OUT --—

dialogues.speaker: THEY STAND TOGETHER AND WATCH THE SHIP --
dialogues.text: PIRATES STEPPING BACK IN FEAR -- KNOWING WHAT’S COMING AS BRITISH SOLDIERS LOOK CONFUSED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS JACK STAYS AT THE WHEEL OF THE REVENGE --—

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Can’t be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE THE SOLDIERS’ GUNS COCKED ON THEIR OWN --

dialogues.speaker: CANNONS ON BOTH SHIPS AIMED AT PIRATES AND SOLDIERS
dialogues.text: HAVE NO IDEA THEY ARE ABOUT TO BE ATTACKED FROM WITHIN -—

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: What’s happening?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: We’re to be boarded now.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Jack... BUT JACK IS ALREADY GONE -- TIP-TOEING BEHIND THE MAST -—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS CAPTAIN BRAND APPEARS ON THE FRONT OF THE REVENGE. HE’

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: So who would like to hear a tale? BRAND STEPS FORWARD NOW -——

dialogues.speaker: OTHER SOLDIERS MAKING IT ACROSS
dialogues.text: GHOSTS HOLDING SWORDS --—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AND THERE’S OLIVIA STANDING ON THE DECK OF THE SHIPWRECK.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: HENRY! THEY’RE HOLDING ME CAPTIVE!!

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: I’M COMING FOR YOU!!!

dialogues.speaker: CARINA BACKING UP IN HORROR
dialogues.text: MORE DEAD MEN --—

dialogues.speaker: DEAD SILENCE NOW AS BRAND AND HIS MEN STAND BEFORE BARBOS
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN BRAND (CONT’D) Did you bring your end?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: I‘’1l be needing the diamond. BRAND PLACES HIS HANGER SWORD AT BARBOSSA’S THROAT -—

dialogues.speaker: BRAND
dialogues.text: When he’s dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN BRAND (CONT’D) I've been waiting to meet the rover who sent me to hell and back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN BRAND (CONT’D) The man who taught my brother the ways of the pirate.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I'm of the belief you can’t teach the aptitude of piracy.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: There be blood on your hands. Prepare to wash them at the bottom of the sea.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: As a statement of fact I did save Eric’s life --

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Well, when you put it that way --

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND HIM
dialogues.text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) I believe we’re no longer in the Triangle. As I said -- impossible to teach.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Let him go.  81.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA WATCHING
dialogues.text: WATCHING AS THE GHOSTS DRAG HER BEFORE BRAND --—

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: And who might this be?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: A witch -- or a wench. Depends who you ask.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: You took the life of someone I loved. Allow me to return the favor.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Love? Wait. Just to be clear -- we're not together.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: He kidnapped me.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: And saved her life --

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: I believe I was making a point --

dialogues.speaker: JACK AND CARINA SAVED FOR THE MOMENT
dialogues.text: FRONT OF THE SHIP --—

dialogues.speaker: SINK IT NOW
dialogues.text: TWO OF BRAND’S GHOSTS GOING AFTER CARINA --

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE WATER --
dialogues.text: THE GHOSTS UNABLE TO REACH HER -- GOING WILD WITH RAGE -—

dialogues.speaker: THE GHOSTS TEARING UP THE SHIP AS CANNONS FIRE
dialogues.text: TEARING THROUGH THE REVENGE -—  82.

dialogues.speaker: JACK ABOUT TO JUMP IN THE WATER
dialogues.text: GOES BACK FOR THE BOTTLE --— HENRY MADDOX HAS NO CHOICE BUT TO DIVE INTO THE OCEAN --—

dialogues.speaker: THE SHIP SINKING AS THE PIRATES JUMP TO ESCAPE THE GHOSTS
dialogues.text: JACK HOLDING THE BOTTLE AT THE FRONT OF THE SHIP -—- ABOU

dialogues.speaker: SIDE
dialogues.text: AND JACK REACHES HIS HAND INTO BRAND’S COAT -- PULLS OUT DIAMOND -- SHOWS IT TO HIM.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Very difficult to teach this.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND UNABLE TO REACH THEM
dialogues.text: - TRAPPED IN HIS OWN WATERY PRISON --—  83.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: OLIVIA’S ALIVE. I HAVE TO SAVE HER! !

dialogues.speaker: CARINA IS SHAKING
dialogues.text: WITH TERROR -——

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Stay on dry land if you wish to live.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Ghosts. Everywhere. I saw them.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: On a positive note -- I have yet to see a lizard. Or a Quaker.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: These be the Coffin Islands -- as named by the woman who found them.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: This must be the burial grounds of Poseidon.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: The Trident is here.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Then lead the way.

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: No woman is going to lead us? Ain’t that right, Captain?  84.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA LOOKS TO BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: IT TO HER. HE’S ABOUT TO SPEAK TO HIS MEN WHEN CARINA JUM

dialogues.speaker: LINED UP ON THE DECK OF THE SILENT MARY. SCRUM, GIBBS AND
dialogues.text: MOST OF JACK’S CREW ARE PRISONERS AS WELL.

dialogues.speaker: GHOST
dialogues.text: These are the survivors, Sir. Cowards fished from the sea.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: Welcome aboard The Silent Mary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN BRAND (CONT’D) Poseidon’s brother Hades was charged with protecting the Tomb. And so he formed the Triangle -- and enlisted the dead to patrol it. Locking them in forever.

dialogues.speaker: SCARFIELD.
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN BRAND (CONT’D) Which is good news for you men -- as you won't be traveling far to the gates of hell! Execute them all.

dialogues.speaker: MELIA
dialogues.text: No. We will need them alive for now.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: We? And why would a witch help a spirit?

dialogues.speaker: MELIA
dialogues.text: I’ve been helping you from the beginning. I engaged Jack Sparrow on this quest, sent him to find the Map and the Trident. I brought these soldiers to you now -- so that our destinies would live together. You see, Captain Brand -- I’ve come to make a deal.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: Jack Sparrow has gone ashore -- there are no deals to be made.

dialogues.speaker: MELIA
dialogues.text: You will bring me the Trident. And with it you will have your freedom. And the revenge you seek.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: And what of your revenge?

dialogues.speaker: MELIA
dialogues.text: To all those who burned witches. There is a storm coming.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: You forget -- we remain locked to these waters...

dialogues.speaker: MELIA
dialogues.text: I have the power to change that, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: THIS IS A HAUNTED HOUSE THAT GOES ON FOREVER
dialogues.text: NOISES AND SOUNDS CAUSING EVERYONE TO BE ON ALERT -—-—  86.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: I wonder how she come to name this the Coffin Islands.

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: We are searching for the tomb of Poseidon.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Seems obvious.

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: The Spanish word for coffin is ataud. I'll wager it’s the name of a famous Spanish explorer. A SECOND PIRATE IS TAKEN BY A PLANT IN THE B.G. -—-

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: She doesn’t look Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: AND GRAB THE LEGS OF THE DOOMED MEN --
dialogues.text: BUT IT ALL HAPPENS SO FAST THERE’S NOTHING TO BE DONE. TH

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Stay together. We’ll rest here.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: The diamond, Jack. I saw you pocket it.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I’m confused, Hector. You made a deal with the dead to trade my life for The Eye -- only to save my life from the very dead man who was supposed to take it -- and now you wish to kill me dead all over again.  87. BARBOSSA TAKES THE DIAMOND -—

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: I never saved your life.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I saw you raise your sword --

dialogues.speaker: THE END OF IT.
dialogues.text: And Jack looks at him -- looks to Carina -- and he finall realizes --

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: You’re in love with her. Barbossa stands frozen -- stares at Jack -- JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) Not that it’s my business, but isn’t she a bit young?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Hold your tongue, Jack. Before I cut it out.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: As one who is recently married, I can suggest you don’t rush into this --

dialogues.speaker: ENOUGH
dialogues.text: AND NOW JACK GRABS BARBOSSA’S HAND -- TURNS HIS WRIST OVE EXPOSE A TATTOO OF A CLOVER.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I’ve seen that clover before. Dangling from Carina’s ear. Bad luck for a sailor. But not a pirate named Barbossa. JACK STARING AT HECTOR NOW -— JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) And there were pirate markings in her diary. Clover in shape next to the equation. The question being, how did she end up with a book that was once in the possession of pirates?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA GRABS HIM NOW
dialogues.text: HE’S GOT NO CHOICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye. The book was stolen by pirates. Pirates who had no way of reading it. So when it came to my hands thirty years ago, I passed it down. As it was all I had to offer.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Passed it down?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: To a three year-old child. The most beautiful child you’ve ever seen. A child I was never to lay eyes on again. Jack staring at Hector.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She's my daughter, Jack. Carina was named by me, and then left with nothing but a book stolen long ago.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: And a dead man’s tale of a father she never knew?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Lies given to her by her mother so she would never be faced with the truth of what I am. And she took to those lies and made them true -- studied by herself until she alone could pull a map from the stars. And now we both chase the same treasure -- as our destiny allows.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: You're certain of this, Hector? With all respect, you’re one of the most hideous men I’ve ever met. There be little resemblance.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Her mother was a raven haired beauty --

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I know mirrors are hard to come by at sea -- so you might not be aware of your own unsightly face --

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: SHE’S MY DAUGHTER, JACK! AND THIS SECRET WILL GO TO BOTH OF OUR GRAVES.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Sounds like an accord is to be struck.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Name your price.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I only came for the Pearl and my life.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: All I wish to hold is the Trident.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: We have an accord.

dialogues.speaker: JACK AND BARBOSSA SHAKE ON IT
dialogues.text: AND HOLDS IT TO JACK’S THROAT.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: A small stipulation. I’ve seen the way her eyes find you, Jack. You’ll be staying away from Carina -- forever. She must never know the pirate’s life. Barbossa walking toward Jack now.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go near my daughter again -- and I’1l kill you where you stand.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: If they offer you tea -- politely decline.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: Jack Sparrow and the Trident are waiting to be taken.

dialogues.speaker: GHOST SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Sir, we are chained to these waters.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: The Witch is casting a spell. Today we're going ashore.  90. And now they all look to the PRISONERS -- who have no ide what’s about to happen to them.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH HEAVY PLANTS --
dialogues.text: AND THERE’S CARINA -- WAITING FOR HIM. HE ALMOST WALKS RI INTO HER -- THE TWO OF THEM INCHES AWAY -—

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: I've been looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Don’t want anyone to see us together -- might think we’re conspiring -- colluding -- perspiring.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: We should keep moving. This island is alive -- and so is Hector.

dialogues.speaker: JACK STILL TRYING TO MOVE PAST HER
dialogues.text: KILL HIM ON SIGHT. BUT SHE WON’T LET HIM PASS.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Whatever happens, I just want you to know that I was wrong about you, Jack. You saved my life three times.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I also kidnapped you -- induced your sale into slavery. And let’s not forget the tea -- the mutiny -- SHE MOVES CLOSER TO HIM NOW --—

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: I know I said the horizon and the stars were destined to never be together. But now I believe I was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: No. Not wrong. You’re never wrong. Have yet to see it --

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Are you saying there’s nothing between us?  gl.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Did I tell you I was married? Happily -- with two unbearable children.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: I've spent my life looking to the stars. Perhaps I should have been looking out to sea.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I will admit, there is something between us.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: The Three Fingers of God.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Well, I'd say you're exaggerating.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: No, behind you! Those rocks line up exactly as the stars of Orion! We’ve found it!!

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: God's finger -- shall we, Hector?

dialogues.speaker: RISE FROM THE ISLAND
dialogues.text: CARINA LOOKING UP AT THEM -——

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Orion is called the hunter. The stars in the shape of a bow just as those are formed. You see it now --

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: The question is -- what are they hunting?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: They seem to be pointed at us.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: There's a cave! Just behind the rocks!

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: That must be it. Come on!

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Wait. Look to the top.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: Looks as if someone built a house of wood on top of those rocks.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: It’s not a house. It’s a nest.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Carina -- did Poseidon have any pets?

dialogues.speaker: UP ONE OF THE PIRATES AND SAILS OUT OF FRAME --
dialogues.text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) This is where I run.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKY --
dialogues.text: THE GIANT BIRDS PICKING OFF CREW MEMBERS ONE BY ONE -—

dialogues.speaker: WE SEE A PIRATE DROPPED INTO ONE OF THE NESTS
dialogues.text: SEVERAL “BABY” SIZED BIRDS ARE WAITING TO EAT HIM --

dialogues.speaker: BUT JACK COMES RUNNING IN BEHIND HER
dialogues.text: CUTS OFF THE BIRD’S FEET AS CARINA FALLS BACK TO THE GROU

dialogues.speaker: THE SCREAMING BIRD TURNS TO COME BACK FOR JACK --
dialogues.text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: SLICE JACK IN HALF --
dialogues.text: BUT A GUNSHOT RINGS OUT -- AND THERE’S BARBOSSA WITH HIS

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER PIRATES RUNNING FOR COVER AS WELL --
dialogues.text: THE GIANT BIRDS DESCENDING ON THEM AS THEY RUN --—

dialogues.speaker: THE GUNSHOTS CAUSING THE BIRDS TO DROP THE PIRATES
dialogues.text: BACK IN ANGER FOR HIM -——

dialogues.speaker: COME AT HIM AT ONCE --
dialogues.text: HE PUTS A BULLET BETWEEN THE EYES OF THE FIRST --—

dialogues.speaker: THE SECOND BIRD ABOUT TO TAKE OUT BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: ALL HIS SHOTS -—-

dialogues.speaker: THE BIRD REACHING FOR HIM WITH HIS TALONS --
dialogues.text: AS JACK TACKLES BARBOSSA TO THE GROUND JUST IN TIME -—-—

dialogues.speaker: THE BIRD CIRCLING BACK FOR THEM --
dialogues.text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) I’1l need to borrow a weapon, Hector.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: I’m out of charge.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I have an idea. Don’t think you’1l like it.

dialogues.speaker: THE BIRD DIVING DOWN AT THEM --
dialogues.text: AND NOW WE SEE JACK GET TO HIS FEET HOLDING BARBOSSA’S WO

dialogues.speaker: LEG --
dialogues.text: JACK SLAMMING THE WOODEN LEG ACROSS THE BIRD’S BEAK -- TH

dialogues.speaker: WITH AN INJURED WING --
dialogues.text: JACK STANDS THERE HOLDING BARBOSSA’S LEG -- JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) This is awkward --

dialogues.speaker: AND NOW THE BIRD IS BACK UP --
dialogues.text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: JACK AND BARBOSSA ENTER THE CAVE WITH THE OTHER SURVIVORS
dialogues.text: exhausted and out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: What is this place?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: This isn’t a place. The map ends here. Look at the walls.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Diamonds.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Those aren't diamonds. They’re stars.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: Choose your legs.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND STEPS INTO THE BODY OF ADMIRAL SCARFIELD --
dialogues.text: BRAND'S EYES BECOME SCARFIELD’S -- AND A GHOST ARMY IS CREATED BEFORE OUR EYES --— CAPTAIN BRAND (CONT’D) Move out. We’re going ashore! INT. - CAVE. — DAY

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: You're saying this is part of the map?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: We’re standing inside it.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: If we’re inside a map, then in theory we could all get folded?

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: Or rolled. That would be bad.

dialogues.speaker: PINTEL
dialogues.text: How do we read it?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: It’s not to be read. It’s to be completed. This cave -- these diamonds -- it’s the solar system -- The Map No Man Can Read. Every star exactly in its place. It’s all here -- we're seeing what God sees.

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: Witch! She’s a witch!

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: We're past that.

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: Diamonds on the walls! What are we waiting for!

dialogues.speaker: DIAMOND --
dialogues.text: PIRATE #2 (CONT’D) I'll be taking this one.  96.

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE ENDLESS DARKNESS --
dialogues.text: Carina is moving toward the walls -- lost in thought --

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: That's the Milky Way, Orion’s Belt. Coming across here is --

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Carina. Bright enough to navigate during a dead moon. Carina looks back at Barbossa --

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Yes. That is Carina.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: So which star are we looking for?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: The one that’s missing. And it’s right there -- that space on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: RAGETTI
dialogues.text: What is it then?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: The third planet from the sun. Earth. We're missing.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Try this.

dialogues.speaker: IT FITS PERFECTLY
dialogues.text: THE LIGHT SHINING ACROSS CARINA’S FACE NOW AS THE ENTIRE

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: The Map is complete.

dialogues.speaker: OPENING --
dialogues.text: EXT. —- TOMB OF POSEIDON FORTRESS. - DAY

dialogues.speaker: STARE ACROSS AT A MASSIVE FORTRESS THAT PROTECTS AN ANCIE
dialogues.text: TOMB. FORTY FOOT WALLS STAND IN FRONT OF THEM -—

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: The Tomb of Poseidon.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: One question. Any birds?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: You men are now vulnerable to gun and sword. And if your flesh and body dies -- you’re to join its rotten spirt in hell.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: It’s real, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: You found it, Carina. Nobody else dare say it was them -- for it bea lie as great as any told. She looks at him now --

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Shall we take a peek?  98.

dialogues.speaker: OPEN IT MEN

dialogues.text: The Trident controls the sea --

dialogues.text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) My water broke... JACK RUNNING WITH THE BOTTLE -—- JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) IT’S COMING!!

dialogues.speaker: PIRATES --
dialogues.text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) IT’S COMING!! THE GLASS BEGINS TO SHATTER -- AND NOW JACK’S IN THE MIDD

dialogues.speaker: OF A CLEARING YELLING AT SOME OF THE PIRATES WHO ARE CLOS
dialogues.text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D)

dialogues.text: BEFORE OUR EYES --—

dialogues.text: SOMETHING YOU’D BUY IN A TOY STORE.

dialogues.text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) Perhaps I was wrong. Maybe size does matter.

dialogues.speaker: SHIP.
dialogues.text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) I think she needs a little more water.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Now hand it this way. The discovery belongs to you. But that Trident is mine.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: I can see it in your eyes -- you will not kill me.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Never trust the eyes of a pirate.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Then run me through, Captain Barbossa. And prove me wrong.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: For the last time --

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: What will you do with it?  100.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Sell it to highest bidder. As is my right.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: How could you give up a treasure like this without a thought? Can you not see it’s perfect? What kind of man are you?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: A pirate. Never to change.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND/SCARFIELD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Find the Trident. And bring me Jack Sparrow!!

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: LET'S SHOW ‘EM HOW TO BLEED!

dialogues.speaker: CARINA RACES THROUGH THE SIDE OF THE COMPOUND AND INTO TH
dialogues.text: woOoDs.

dialogues.text: BARBOSSA SLICING HIS WAY THROUGH THE POSSESSED MEN -—

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Gibbs, Scrum -- we’ll have to fight our way out.

dialogues.speaker: THE MEN STARE AT HIM
dialogues.text: THEY RAISE THEIR SWORDS -—— JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) You both look a bit pale. Are you not well? A touch of Scurvy perhaps?

dialogues.speaker: AS THEY COME STRAIGHT AT HIM --
dialogues.text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) I can see you're still upset with me --

dialogues.speaker: THROAT --
dialogues.text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: FORTRESS
dialogues.text: CUT SCRUM’S HAND -- JACK SPARROW (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: OKAY
dialogues.text: JACK RUNNING FROM THEM NOW -—

dialogues.text: HAND -- CUTTING THROUGH GHOSTS SOLDIERS ONE BY ONE --—

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF HIM
dialogues.text: CIRCLE EACH OTHER --—

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND/SCARFIELD
dialogues.text: We had a deal, Captain Barbossa.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: It would seem a ghost and a pirate should avoid doing business.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND/SCARFIELD
dialogues.text: Today I am no ghost. But soon you will be. CAPTAIN BRAND OPENS HIS COAT -- REVEALING SCARFIELD’S PIS  102. BARBOSSA’S HAND MOVING TOWARD HIS BLUNDERBUSS --

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND/SCARFIELD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You will pay for your betrayal.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Aye. A betrayal it was.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND/SCARFIELD
dialogues.text: This repugnant flesh does me no good. JACK COMING AT HIM AGAIN -- BUT BRAND’S MEN STEP IN FRONT

dialogues.speaker: DISTANCE --
dialogues.text: HE REMOVES JACK’S SWORD -- HOLDS IT AS HIS OWN AS HE YELL

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: This way. Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: GHOST
dialogues.text: Should we kill them?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND/SCARFIELD
dialogues.text: I want them to see this. EXT. — TOMB OF POSEIDON. - DAY JACK RUSHES TO BARBOSSA’S SIDE -- HELPS HIM UP.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Where’s the Trident?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: I let her go, Jack. This time I’1l1 never get her back.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Henry --

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: I said I'd come back -- we'll escape together.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Please -- you have to go.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: I won’t leave you again. From the moment I saw you, I knew where my destiny lies --

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: It’s not safe.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: You're forgetting. I’m lucky. CAPTAIN BRAND STEPS OUT OF SCARFIELD’S WOUNDED BODY --

dialogues.speaker: MELIA
dialogues.text: The sea is yours, Captain. Take your revenge.

dialogues.speaker: AS A TIDAL WAVE STARTS TO FORM
dialogues.text: IN FRONT OF BRAND’S SHIP -- THE GHOST ORCHESTRATING THE W

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Jack Sparrow.

dialogues.speaker: THE ISLAND --
dialogues.text: EXT. — TOMB OF POSEIDON. - DAY

dialogues.speaker: JACK AND BARBOSSA ARE GONE --
dialogues.text: EXT. —- SILENT MARY. —- CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: MELIA
dialogues.text: You're free, Captain. The boundary is gone. SHE WALKS OVER -- STANDS WITH HIM -—-

dialogues.speaker: MELIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A witch and a ghost shall rule it all. CAPTAIN BRAND LOOKS TO HIS MEN -——

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: My very dead men -- listen to your Captain. From this moment on, every ship at sea is ours to destroy! Every sailor, pirate and soldier is ours to kill. We will not stop until the oceans of the world turn to blood!  106. EXT. —- OPEN OCEAN. - DAY

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: See -- just needed a bit more water.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SEES BARBOSSA LYING UNCONSCIOUS ON DECK --
dialogues.text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) Hector...are you dead? Don’t answer that if you are. Maybe I should slap you -- always wanted to slap you -- Jack goes to slap him -- but Barbossa catches his hand.

dialogues.speaker: / BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Carina? Barbossa lifts himself up -- struggles to get to his feet JACK STANDS NEXT TO HIM -—- THE TWO OF THEM LOOK OUT AT T

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She's gone, isn’t she?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: The dead took her. And the sea.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: I keep making the same mistake, Jack. Finding things not meant to be found.

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY THERE IS A FLASH OF LIGHT COMING FROM THE SILENT
dialogues.text: MARY -- A REFLECTION WAY OFF IN THE DISTANCE --—

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is that?  107. EXT. —- SILENT MARY. —- CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: ON DECK
dialogues.text: NECK AND REFLECTING ACROSS THE SEA --—

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Hector -- she’s alive.

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Then there be only one question. Is this still the fastest ship at sea?

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Miss, my clothes are all wet -- any idea how that might have happened?

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: And I seem to be missing my little finger. Sliced clean off at the tip -- very strange. Scrum holds up his bloody hand.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Will you help me escape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BLACK PEARL IS SPEEDING TOWARD THE SILENT MARY -—- JA

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Henry -- wait.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: Come with me now. We’1ll take our chances at sea.

dialogues.speaker: HE LEADS HER UP TO THE DECK
dialogues.text: -- HOLDS JACK’S SWORD IN HIS HAND.  108.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: The Captain’s servant. Did you come to hear another tale, boy?

dialogues.speaker: BRAND THROWS HENRY A SWORD --
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN BRAND (CONT’D) Take your irons. So you can die like a soldier.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND LAUGHS
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN BRAND (CONT’D) I am not afraid!

dialogues.speaker: AS HE EASILY FIGHTS HIM OFF --
dialogues.text: THEY FIGHT FOR A BEAT UNTIL HENRY’S SWORD IS KNOCKED FREE

dialogues.speaker: GHOST --
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN BRAND (CONT’D) I‘1l make this quick. BRAND COMES AT HIM -- BUT OLIVIA JUMPS IN FRONT OF HIM -—

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: Olivia!! THE SWORD GOES INTO HER -— AND BRAND QUICKLY REMOVES IT. HENRY LOOKS DOWN -- SEES THERE’S NO BLOOD -- HENRY MADDOX (CONT’D) Olivia? HE LOOKS AT HER -- SEES THAT SHE’S NOT IN PAIN -- HAS NO REACTION TO THE SWORD -—

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry --

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You returned for a ghost. AND ALL AT ONCE HE REALIZES -- SHE’S BEEN DEAD ALL ALONG.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was killed that night at sea. But my last thoughts were of you.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: Now let’s finish this, boy.

dialogues.speaker: SHIP TO THE AFT
dialogues.text: BRAND SEES THE BLACK PEARL CHARGING UP FROM BEHIND -—

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: Sparrow!! INT. - SILENT MARY. -— CONTINUOUS Carina is MOVING THROUGH THE HULL OF THE SILENT MARY WITH GIBBS AND SCRUM --—

dialogues.text: SHIP -—- AND THERE’S THE BLACK PEARL SAILING ALONG SIDE --

dialogues.text: See -- timing is everything. CAPTAIN BRAND CHARGING STRAIGHT THROUGH THE MAST -—- COMI

dialogues.speaker: TOWARD THE PEARL --

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: No. He’s mine.

dialogues.text: THE BLOODY SPEAR IN HIS HAND -——

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: I came back for the Trident.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: You’ve saved me twice.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA EYEING HIM NOW AS HE PULLS HIS HAND AWAY --
dialogues.text: CARINA SMYTH (CONT’D) If you have something you wish to say to me, say it now before it can never be said again.  111.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you the one who left me Galileo’s Diary? Who left me an equation to solve?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: I’M SHORT OF MEN AND RACING THE DEAD!

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: BARBOSSA CAN’T LOOK AT HER -—

dialogues.text: Please -- what am I to you?

dialogues.speaker: BARBOSSA
dialogues.text: Carina -- what could you be to a pirate?

dialogues.speaker: JACK --
dialogues.text: He’s staring out at the sea -- a familiar look on his fac the wonder of the ocean clearly in his eyes.

dialogues.text: SHE’S GAINING ON US! CARINA WALKING TOWARD JACK NOW -—-

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Jack -- what are you doing?

dialogues.text: No one should control her.

dialogues.speaker: CURTAINS OF WATER PUSHING THEMSELVES APART AS BIG AND SMA
dialogues.text: FISH DROP FROM THE SIDES -- FLOPPING TO THE SEA FLOOR --—

dialogues.text: WATERFALL -—— SCRUM LOOKING DOWN -- TURNS TO JACK -—-

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: The backside of water. Don’t see that every day. CARINA LOOKS AT JACK -- WATCHES AS HE GRABS A ROPE --—

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Lower me down, Hector.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Jack -- wait. There’s no coming back from the bottom of the sea.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Is this your way of saying you’d like my hat?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: You don’t have to do this.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I have to put it back.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: But the Trident is yours -- you have everything now.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: This was my destiny. To find it and die for it. Or something like that. So hard to concentrate when a witch is naked.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: But you don’t believe in destiny. Then I’ve

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: got nothing to worry about.  113.

dialogues.text: WALLS OF WATER -—

dialogues.speaker: A SAILFISH SLICES THROUGH THE CURTAIN
dialogues.text: IN JACK AS IT QUICKLY WITHDRAWS --—

dialogues.speaker: DEEP REDUCED TO HELPLESSNESS.
dialogues.text: CARINA SMYTH (CONT’D) Look there. IN THE SEA WALL before them, rising up like a canyon, the see a huge BLUE WHALE swim lazily past. Like a fish ina tropical aquarium, but on a scale of the pyramids.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: There it is.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHIP COMPLETELY VERTICAL AS CAPTAIN BRAND AND HIS MEN
dialogues.text: STAND ON DECK -- EYEING JACK AND CARINA --— JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) Hurry. THE TRIDENT IN JACK’S HAND AS THEY HEAD FOR POSEIDON’S TO

dialogues.speaker: A TOWERING MENACE THREATENING TO RELEASE. THE SEAS HELD B
dialogues.text: BUT FIGHTING TO BE FREE -—— NOTHING BUT BLUE SKIES OVERHEAD.  114.

dialogues.speaker: OVER THE SIDE
dialogues.text: MELIA APPEARS BEHIND HIM NOW -- SHE’S COME FROM THE SILEN

dialogues.speaker: MELIA
dialogues.text: ‘Tis time to die.

dialogues.speaker: MELIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That sword will not save you -- SHE’S USING HER POWERS TO PUSH HIS SWORD TO THE SIDE -- LEAVING BARBOSSA WITH NO WEAPON.

dialogues.speaker: THE SILENT MARY IS SAILING ACROSS THE SAND DUNES AT THE
dialogues.text: BOTTOM OF THE SEA --—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARBOSSA IS BACKING UP FROM MELIA. SHE’S GOT HIM CORNERED NOW -- IS READY TO KILL HIM.

dialogues.speaker: MELIA
dialogues.text: Your secret is safe, Captain Barbossa. She'll never know the truth. Dead Men Tell No Tales. SUDDENLY A KNIFE IS PLUNGED INTO MELIA’S BACK -- AND SHE OUT A HORRIBLE SCREAM -——  115.

dialogues.speaker: AS SHE TURNS AND STABS HIM WITH HER DAGGER --
dialogues.text: HENRY AND MELIA LYING SIDE BY SIDE ON THE DECK --— HENRY LOOKS UP AS OLIVIA APPEARS BEFORE HIM. SHE’S WITH H

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: It’s okay. We’1ll be together now. SUDDENLY WE SEE AGONY IN HENRY’S EYES -- AN AGONY NOT FRO

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I can’t come with you.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY SLOWLY SITS UP
dialogues.text: GOING TO LIVE. IT’S THE WITCH WHO HAS DIED.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: I'll be waiting.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK AND CARINA ARE AT POSEIDON’S TOMB -- BOTH STRUGGLING PUSH THE HEAVY LID ASIDE --— AS CAPTAIN BRAND APPEARS BEFORE THEM WITH JACK’S SWORD. THEY STAND FROZEN BEFORE BRAND AND HIS DEAD MEN.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: This is your sword, Jack Sparrow. BRAND HOLDS JACK’S SWORD IN FRONT OF HIM -- CAPTAIN BRAND (CONT’D) It will cut your throat -- exactly as I cut my own --

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: This was the part I was hoping to avoid. AND NOW BRAND LIFTS JACK’S SWORD -- JUST AS THE WITCH

dialogues.speaker: TRIDENT IS CUT IN HALF --
dialogues.text: WE SEE THE ANCIENT SCEPTER DROP TO THE SAND -— EVERYTHING TURNING DARK AND GRAY --— THE GROUND STARTING TO SHIFT -- THE SAND PARTING --—

dialogues.speaker: ALL OF THE DEAD WHO WERE KILLED BY BRAND IN THE TRIANGLE
dialogues.text: sae eans NS OUT FROM THE DIRT AND MUCK AND OUT OF THE

dialogues.speaker: SAILORS AND SOLDIERS ALIKE STANDING TOGETHER
dialogues.text: MEN NOW SURROUNDED BY THESE GHOSTS --—

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: You killed these men. Sank their ships. They died by your hand and were forced through the gates of hell.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN BRAND
dialogues.text: Eric -- brother -- we can be together again. We can rule the sea!

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: We will be together. Forever.

dialogues.speaker: GATES OF HELL FOREVER --
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN BRAND THE LAST TO GO -——

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: There...  117. IT’S AN ANCHOR DROPPED FROM THE BLACK PEARL --

dialogues.speaker: ANCHOR SWINGS UP TOWARD THE SURFACE
dialogues.text: SEA BEGINS TO COLLAPSE ALL AROUND THEM -—

dialogues.speaker: AND BARBOSSA KNOWS HE HAS NO CHOICE
dialogues.text: AND WITH ONE MIGHTY SWING BARBOSSA USES BLACKBEARD’S SWOR CUT THE ANCHOR THAT HE’S HOLDING --

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: No. NO!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TO REVEAL A CALM AND PERFECT SEA --—

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: A Pirate’s life.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: Sand the keel and scrape those barnacles, boy! Captain Sparrow won’t tolerate any dallying!

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: Aye, Mr. Scrum.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Move it, Lucky. We're preparing to sail with the sun.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY MADDOX
dialogues.text: Mr. Gibbs, is it true there be a pound of gold waiting for each man?

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Two pounds -- you’ll see!

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: What is Oxford?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: It’s a University. I’11 be the first female astronomy student. Assuming they believe my story.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Oh, I think they’1l believe it.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: And how can you be so sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe this will help. AND NOW JACK HANDS HER “THE EYE” -- THE YELLOW DIAMOND SPARKLING IN HER HAND.

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: What kind of pirate gives up his treasure? 119.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: Who said I’ve given anything up?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: I'll keep this diamond with the hopes that one day you’1ll do the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: And what might that be?

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: You're a pirate. Steal it back. CARINA GETS INTO THE COACH -- AND THE HORSES TAKE OFF. WATCHES FOR A BEAT --—

dialogues.speaker: DIGNIFIED LOOKING MEN. SHE TAKES OUT A LEATHER FLASK
dialogues.text: A LONG STIFF DRINK -- OFFERS THEM THE FLASK -——

dialogues.speaker: CARINA SMYTH
dialogues.text: Pirate’s tea, anyone? THE MEN LOOK HORRIFIED AS SHE SITS BACK AND SMILES -——

dialogues.speaker: HER CLOVER EARRING DANGLING IN THE SUN.
dialogues.text: EXT. —- BLACK PEARL. - DAY

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: As promised, give these diamonds to the crew, Scrum.

dialogues.speaker: SCRUM
dialogues.text: Aye, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: Good news, Captain. One of the men found this washed ashore in the harbor. How’s that for luck? GIBBS IS HOLDING JACK’S SWORD. JACK HESITATES FOR A LONG BEAT -- THEN TAKES HIS SWORD AND PUTS IT IN HIS BELT -—

dialogues.speaker: MR. GIBBS
dialogues.text: So where we headed, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: We'll be following the stars, Mr. Gibbs. Wherever they may take us.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: It’s good to have the Black Pearl back, is it not, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: JACK SPARROW
dialogues.text: I’ve been thinking, Gibbs. Perhaps this ship could use a new name. A name to strike fear into our enemies -- and bring us more treasure than we could imagine.

dialogues.speaker: GIBBS
dialogues.text: And what name did you have in mind, Sir?
